  4750                                  
  4751                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  4752                                  ; diskette drives:
  4753                                  ;
  4754                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  4755                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  4756                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  4757                                  ;
  4758                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  4759                                  ;
  4760                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  4761                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  4762                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  4763                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)
  4764                                  					
  4765 00001871 30D2                    		xor	dl, dl
  4766                                  
  4767                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4768                                  		; ds = cs
  4769                                  		; 17/06/2018		 
  4770                                  		;push	cs
  4771                                  		;pop	ds
  4772                                  
  4773 00001873 C606[2C01]09            		mov	byte [eot], 9
  4774 00001878 BF[1901]                		mov	di, start_bds 	; if we	are faking floppy drives we need
  4775                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  4776                                  
  4777                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  4778                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  4779                                  
  4780                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  4781                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  4782                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  4783                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  4784                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  4785                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  4786                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  4787                                  ; the bds for harddrives.
  4788                                  
  4789 0000187B 803E[8715]01            		cmp	byte [fakefloppydrv], 1
  4790 00001880 750B                    		jnz	short loop_drive
  4791 00001882 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  4792                                  					; di <-	first bds link
  4793 00001884 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  4794                                  					; di <-	second bds link
  4795 00001886 C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; -1 ; set end of link
  4796 0000188A E90801                  		jmp	dohard		; allocate/initialise bds for harddrives
  4797                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  4799                                  loop_drive:

  4839                                  ; if cmos is bad, it gives es,ax,bx,cx,dh,di=0. cy=0.

  4841                                  ; we are going to set ch=39,cl=9,dh=1 to avoid divide overflow when
  4842                                  ; they are calculated at the later time. this is just for the diagnostic
  4843                                  ; diskette which need msbio,msdos to boot up before it sets cmos.
  4844                                  ; this should only happen with drive b.

  5103                                  ; up a logical drive. it needs to have the same int13 drive number as its
  5104                                  ; counterpart, but the next drive letter. also reset ownership flag.
  5105                                  ; we detect the presence of this situation by examining the flag single for the

  5110 00001952 80F120                  		xor	cl, 20h	; fi_own_physical

  5226                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5227                                  ; if more than 2 diskette drives on the system, then it is necessary to remap
  5228                                  ; the bds chain to adjust the logical drive num (drive letter) with greater
  5229                                  ; than two diskette drives
  5230                                  ;
  5231                                  ; new scheme:	if more than 2 disktte drives, first map the bds structure
  5232                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5233                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5234                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5235                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5236                                  ;		drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5237                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5238

  5240                                  		;jbe	short static_configure ; no - no need for remapping
  5241 000019F1 7603                    		jbe	short no_remap
  5242 000019F3 E8D800                  		call	remap		; remap	bds chain to adjust driver letters
  5243                                  no_remap:
  5244                                  
  5245                                  ; End of drive initialization.
  5246                                  
  5247                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5248                                  
  5249                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5250                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5251                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5252                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5253                                  ;
  5254                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5255                                  ;
  5256                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5257                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5258                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5259                                  ;use to start with.
  5260                                  ;
  5261                                  ;secondly, "dynamic configuration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5262                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5263                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5264                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5265                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5266                                  
  5267                                  ; -- begin changed section
  5268                                  ;
  5269                                  ;   1.	 basic configuration for msbio (endfloppy)
  5270                                  ;   2.   end96tpi	; a system that supports "change line error"
  5271                                  ;   3.	 end of bdss	; end of bdss for hard disks
  5272                                  ;   4.	 endatrom	;some of at rom fix module.
  5273                                  ;   5.	 endcmosclockset;supporting program for cmos clock write.
  5274                                  ;   6.	 endk09 	;k09 cmos clock module to handle suspend/resume operation.
  5275                                  ;

  5349                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  5350                                  ;
  5351                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5352                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5353                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5354                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5355                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5356                                  ; off of it.
  5357                                  ;
  5358                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5359                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5360                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5361                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  5362                                  ; when to install the hook.

  5643                                  					; (First cluster field of 2nd dir entry
  5644                                  					; of root directory in the buffer at 500h)
  5645                                  		pop	ds
  5646                                  loadit:
  5647                                  		mov	ax, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  5648                                  		;mov	ax, 46Dh	; sysinit segment
  5649                                  		mov	es, ax
  5650                                  		mov	es, [es:CURRENTDOSLOCATION] ; 09/12/2022
  5651                                  		;mov	es, [es:271h]
  5652                                  
  5653                                  		call	getclus		; read cluster at ES:DI (DI is updated)
  5654                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5655                                  ;iseof:
  5656                                  		;;test	byte [cs:fbigfat], fbig
  5657                                  		;test	byte [cs:fbigfat], 40h ; fbig
  5658                                  		; 12/12/2023
  5659                                  		; ds = cs
  5660                                  		test	byte [fbigfat], 40h ; fbig
  5661                                  		jnz	short eofbig
  5662                                  		cmp	bx, 0FF7h
  5663                                  		jmp	short iseofx
  5664                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5665                                  
  5666                                  eofbig:
  5667                                  		cmp	bx, 0FFF7h
  5668                                  iseofx:
  5669                                  		jb	short loadit	; keep loading until cluster = eof
  5670                                  %endif
  5671                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5672                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5673                                  
  5674 00001AC6 E8BE03                  		call	setdrvparms	; 
  5675                                  
  5676                                  		;;jmp	far ptr	46Dh:267h ; jmp	SYSINIT_SEG:SYSINIT_START
  5677                                  		;jmp	far 46Dh:267h
  5678 00001AC9 EA[6902]2704            		jmp	SYSINITSEG:SYSINITSTART
  5679                                  
  5680                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  5681                                  
  5682                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  5683                                  ;
  5684                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  5685                                  
  5686                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5687                                  
  5688                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5689                                  ; module name: remap
  5690                                  ;
  5691                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5692                                  ;
  5693                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5694                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5695                                  ;
  5696                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5697                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  5698                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5699                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5700                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5701                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5702                                  
  5703                                  ; input:       none
  5704                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  5705                                  ; exit error:  none
  5706                                  ; called from: msinit
  5707                                  ;
  5708                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  5709                                  ;	  found in the system
  5710                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  5711                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  5712                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  5713                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  5714                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  5715                                  ;
  5716                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5717                                  
  5718                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5719                                  ; 02/10/2022
  5720                                  
  5721                                  		; 15/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1) IBMBIO.COM
  5722                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:2464h)
  5723                                  		; (MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS - BIOSDATA:1D9Eh)
  5724                                  
  5725                                  remap:		; proc near
  5726                                  
  5727                                  		; 15/12/2023
  5728                                  		; ds = cs
  5729                                  		;mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  5730 00001ACE 8B3E[1901]              		mov	di, [start_bds]
  5731                                  
  5732                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  5733                                  
  5734                                  drive_loop:
  5735 00001AD2 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5736                                  					; first	hard disk??
  5737 00001AD6 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  5738 00001AD8 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5739                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  5740 00001ADA 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1 ; 0FFFFh	; last bds?
  5741 00001ADD 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  5742 00001ADF EB49                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  5743                                  
  5744                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5745                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  5746                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  5747                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5748                                  
  5749                                  fdrv_found:
  5750 00001AE1 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  5751                                  fdrv_loop:
  5752 00001AE3 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5753 00001AE6 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5754                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  5755                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  5756                                  		; 18/12/2022
  5757 00001AE8 40                      		inc	ax
  5758 00001AE9 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ?
  5759 00001AEC 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk drives
  5760                                  
  5761                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5762                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  5763                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  5764                                  ; any more.
  5765                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5766                                  
  5767                                  		;mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  5768                                  		; 15/12/2023
  5769 00001AEE 8B3E[1901]              		mov	di, [start_bds]	; get first bds
  5770 00001AF2 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5771                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  5772                                  		;mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  5773 00001AF4 8A26[2501]              		mov	ah, [dsktnum]
  5774 00001AF8 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  5775                                  remap_loop1:
  5776 00001AFB 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5777                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  5778 00001AFD 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5779 00001B00 FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  5780 00001B02 FECC                    		dec	ah		; count down extra floppies
  5781 00001B04 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  5782                                  
  5783                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  5784                                  
  5785                                  		; 15/12/2023
  5786                                  		;mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  5787 00001B06 A0[7E15]                		mov	al, [drvfat]
  5788 00001B09 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  5789 00001B0B 721D                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  5790                                  		;sub	al, [cs:dsktnum]
  5791 00001B0D 2A06[2501]              		sub	al, [dsktnum]	; is it one of the other floppies?
  5792 00001B11 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  5793                                  
  5794                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  5795                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  5796                                  
  5797 00001B13 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  5798 00001B15 EB04                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  5799                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5800                                  
  5801                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  5802                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  5803                                  
  5804                                  remap_boot_flop:
  5805                                  		;add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  5806                                  		; 15/12/2023
  5807 00001B17 0206[7500]              		add	al, [drvmax]
  5808                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  5809                                  		;mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  5810 00001B1B A2[7E15]                		mov	[drvfat], al
  5811 00001B1E FEC0                    		inc	al
  5812 00001B20 1E                      		push	ds
  5813 00001B21 BF2704                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  5814                                  		;mov	di, 544h	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  5815                                  		;;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  5816 00001B24 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  5817 00001B26 A2[9802]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  5818                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  5819                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  5820 00001B29 1F                      		pop	ds ; ds = cs
  5821                                  rmap_exit:
  5822 00001B2A C3                      		retn
  5823                                  
  5824                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5825                                  
  5826                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5827                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  5828                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  5829                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  5830                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  5831                                  ;**************************************************
  5832                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  5833                                  ;
  5834                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  5835                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  5836                                  ;
  5837                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  5838                                  ;**************************************************
  5839                                  
  5840                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5841                                  bootbias equ 200h
  5842                                  
  5843                                  getboot:	; proc near
  5844                                  
  5845                                  		; 15/12/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 
  5846                                  		;	 (Modified MSDOS 6.22) IO.SYS
  5847                                  		; ds = cs
  5848                                  		
  5849                                  		; 08/04/2018
  5850                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  5851                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  5852                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5853                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  5854                                  
  5855                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  5856                                  		; 15/12/2023
  5857 00001B2B A1[8115]                		mov	ax, [init_bootseg]
  5858 00001B2E 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  5859                                  
  5860                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5861 00001B30 BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  5862                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  5863                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  5864 00001B33 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  5865 00001B36 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  5866 00001B38 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  5867 00001B3B CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  5868                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  5869                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  5870                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  5871 00001B3D 7209                    		jb	short erret
  5872                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5873 00001B3F 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  5874                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  5875                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  5876 00001B46 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  5877                                  erret:
  5878 00001B48 F9                      		stc
  5879                                  norm_ret:
  5880 00001B49 C3                      		retn
  5881                                  
  5882                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5883                                  		
  5884                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.22)
  5885                                  
  5886                                  chk_partition_type:
  5887                                  		; 16/12/2023
  5888 00001B4A 268A07                  		mov	al, [es:bx]	; partition type
  5889                                  
  5890                                  		; see if partitiontype == 1, 4, 6
  5891 00001B4D 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; FAT12
  5892 00001B4F 7406                    		je	short chk_ptype_retn
  5893 00001B51 3C04                    		cmp	al, 4		; FAT16 CHS (<= 32MB)
  5894 00001B53 7402                    		je	short chk_ptype_retn
  5895 00001B55 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; FAT16 BIG CHS (> 32MB)
  5896                                  chk_ptype_retn:
  5897                                  		; zf = 1 -> primary DOS partition
  5898                                  		; zf = 0 -> not a primary DOS partition
  5899 00001B57 C3                      		retn
  5900                                  
  5901                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5902                                  
  5903                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  5904                                  
  5905                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5906                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  5907                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  5908                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  5909                                  ;   determine version number
  5910                                  ;
  5911                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  5912                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  5913                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  5914                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  5915                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  5916                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  5917                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  5918                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5919                                  
  5920                                  sethard:	; proc near
  5921                                  		; 16/12/2023
  5922                                  		; 12/08/2023
  5923                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  5924 00001B58 57                      		push	di
  5925 00001B59 53                      		push	bx
  5926                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 14/08/2023
  5927 00001B5A 06                      		push	es
  5928 00001B5B 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5929 00001B5E 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5930 00001B61 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  5931                                  					; fnon_removable
  5932 00001B65 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  5933                                  					; ffHardFile
  5934 00001B69 C606[8015]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  5935 00001B6E 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  5936 00001B70 52                      		push	dx
  5937 00001B71 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  5938 00001B73 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  5939                                  					; DL = drive number
  5940                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  5941                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  5942                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  5943 00001B75 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  5944 00001B77 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  5945 00001B7A 5A                      		pop	dx
  5946 00001B7B 7249                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  5947 00001B7D 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  5948 00001B80 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  5949 00001B83 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  5950 00001B84 E8A4FF                  		call	getboot
  5951 00001B87 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  5952 00001B88 723C                    		jb	short setret
  5953 00001B8A BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  5954                                  
  5955                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  5956                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  5957                                  
  5958                                  act_part:
  5959 00001B8D 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  5960 00001B92 740B                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  5961                                  ; 16/12/2023
  5962                                  %if 0
  5963                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  5964                                  		jz	short got_good_act
  5965                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  5966                                  		jz	short got_good_act
  5967                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  5968                                  		jnz	short no_act
  5969                                  %endif
  5970                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.22)
  5971                                  		; check if it is a primary dos partition
  5972                                  
  5973 00001B94 E8B3FF                  		call	chk_partition_type
  5974 00001B97 7506                    		jne	short no_act
  5975                                  
  5976                                  got_good_act:
  5977 00001B99 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  5978 00001B9B 742D                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  5979 00001B9D FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  5980                                  no_act:
  5981 00001B9F 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  5982 00001BA2 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  5983                                  					; last entry done?
  5984 00001BA6 75E5                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  5985 00001BA8 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  5986                                  					; restore original value of bx
  5987                                  
  5988                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  5989                                  
  5990                                  get_primary:				
  5991 00001BAB 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  5992 00001BB0 750B                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  5993                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  5994                                  ; 16/12/2023
  5995                                  %if 0
  5996                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  5997                                  		jz	short got_prim
  5998                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  5999                                  		jz	short got_prim
  6000                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6001                                  		jnz	short not_prim
  6002                                  %endif
  6003                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.22)
  6004                                  		; check if it is a primary dos partition
  6005                                  
  6006 00001BB2 E895FF                  		call	chk_partition_type
  6007 00001BB5 7506                    		jne	short not_prim
  6008                                  
  6009                                  got_prim:
  6010 00001BB7 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6011 00001BB9 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6012 00001BBB FECE                    		dec	dh
  6013                                  not_prim:
  6014 00001BBD 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6015 00001BC0 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6016 00001BC4 75E5                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6017                                  setret:					
  6018 00001BC6 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6019 00001BC7 E98502                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6020                                  
  6021                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6022                                  
  6023                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6024                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6025                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6026                                  ;
  6027                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6028                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6029                                  ;  without change.
  6030                                  ;
  6031                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6032                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6033                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6034                                  
  6035                                  set2:
  6036                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6037                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  6038 00001BCA 8816[8315]              		mov	[rom_drv_num], dl
  6039                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  6040                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6041 00001BCE 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6042 00001BD2 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6043                                  
  6044                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  6045                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  6046                                  
  6047 00001BD6 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6048 00001BD9 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6049 00001BDC 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  6050 00001BE0 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  6051 00001BE4 7305                    		jnc	short okdrive
  6052 00001BE6 800E[8015]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  6053                                  okdrive:
  6054 00001BEB 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  6055 00001BEF 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6056                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  6057 00001BF2 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  6058 00001BF6 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6059 00001BF9 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)

  6505                                  ; ****** cas ---
  6506                                  ; IBM DOS 3.30 doesn't seem to mind that the TOTAL_SECTORS and
  6507                                  ; BIG_TOTAL_SECTORS field in the boot sector are 0000. This
  6508                                  ; happens with some frequency -- perhaps through some OS/2 setup
  6509                                  ; program. We haven't actually been COPYING the TOTAL_SECTORS
  6510                                  ; from the boot sector into the DPB anyway, we've just been using
  6511                                  ; it for calculating the fat size. Pretty scary, huh? For now,
  6512                                  ; we'll go ahead and copy it into the DPB, except in the case
  6513                                  ; that it equals zero, in which case we just use the values in
  6514                                  ; the DPB from the partition table.

  6741                                  ; we don't need to change "small fat" logic since it is guaranteed
  6742                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  6743                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  6744                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!

  6746 00001DD9 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; 12 bit fat (FAT12 fs)
  6747 00001DDB 88EB                    		mov	bl, ch

  6751 00001DE2 43                      		inc	bx		; BDS.secperclus

  6756 00001DEC 81C3FF01                		add	bx, 511		; bx +=	511 + bx/2
  6757 00001DF0 D0EF                    		shr	bh, 1		; bh >>= 1; (=bx/512)

  6763                                  ; for bigfat we do need to extend this logic to 32 bit sector calculation.
  6764                                  
  6765                                  dobig:					
  6766 00001DF7 B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; 16 (2^4) directory entries per sector
  6767 00001DF9 52                      		push	dx		; save total sectors (high)
  6768 00001DFA 8B550C                  		mov	dx, [di+0Ch]	; [di+BDS.direntries]
  6769 00001DFD D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl		; root dir sectors = BDS.direntries / 16;
  6770 00001DFF 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
  6771 00001E01 5A                      		pop	dx
  6772 00001E02 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= total	sectors	- root dir sectors
  6773 00001E05 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6774 00001E08 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= t - r	- d
  6775                                  					; total	secs - reserved	secs - root dir	secs
  6776 00001E0B B302                    		mov	bl, 2
  6777 00001E0D 8A7D08                  		mov	bh, [di+8]	; [di+BDS.secperclus]
  6778                                  					; bx = 256 * BDS.secperclus + 2
  6779                                  
  6780                                  ; I don't understand why to add bx here!!!
  6781                                  
  6782                                  		; 29/12/2018 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.0)
  6783                                  		; 27/09/2022
  6784                                  		; (Microsoft FAT32 File	System Specification,
  6785                                  		; December 2000, Page 21)
  6786                                  		; TmpVal1 = DskSize - (BPB_ResvdSecCnt+RootrDirSectors)
  6787                                  		; TmpVal2 = (256*BPB_SecPerClus)+BPB_NumFATs
  6788                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
  6789                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32)
  6790                                  		;   TmpVal2 = TmpVal2 / 2;
  6791                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  6792                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
  6793                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32) {
  6794                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = 0;
  6795                                  		;   BPB_FATSz32 = FATSz;
  6796                                  		;} else {
  6797                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz);
  6798                                  		;/* there is no BPB_FATSz32 in a FAT16 BPB */
  6799                                  		;}
  6800                                  					; dx:ax = TmpVal1, bx = TmpVal2
  6801 00001E10 01D8                    		add	ax, bx		; 
  6802 00001E12 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2
  6803 00001E15 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1		
  6804 00001E18 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2-1
  6805                                  
  6806                                  ; assuming dx in the table will never be bigger than bx.
  6807                                  
  6808 00001E1B F7F3                    		div	bx		; BDS.fatsecs =
  6809                                  					; ceil((total-dir-res)/(256*BDS.secperclus+2))
  6810 00001E1D 894511                  		mov	[di+11h], ax	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  6811                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  6812                                  
  6813                                  ; now, set the default filesys_id, volume label, serial number
  6814                                  
  6815                                  		; 05/08/2023

  6817                                  		;
  6818                                  		;;mov	bl, ds:fbigfat
  6819                                  		;; 17/10/2022

  6821                                  		;mov	[di+1Fh], bl	; [di+BDS.fatsiz] ; fat	size flag

  7012                                  ; setdrvparms sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the system based on
  7013                                  ; the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the various form factors
  7014                                  ; are present in the bpbtable. for hard files, the recommended bpb is the same

  7213                                  
  7214                                  ; domini **********************************************************************
  7215                                  ;
  7216                                  ;mini disk initialization routine. called right after dohard
  7217                                  ;modified for >2 hardfile support
  7218                                  ;
  7219                                  ; **cs=ds=es=datagrp
  7220                                  ;
  7221                                  ; **domini will search for every extended partition in the system, and
  7222                                  ;   initialize it.
  7223                                  ;
  7224                                  ; **bdsm stands for bds table for mini disk and located right after the label
  7225                                  ;   end96tpi. end_of_bdsm will have the offset value of the ending
  7226                                  ;   address of bdsm table.
  7227                                  ;
  7228                                  ; **bdsm is the same as usual bds structure except that tim_lo, tim_hi entries
  7229                                  ;   are overlapped and used to identify mini disk and the number of hidden_trks.
  7230                                  ;   right now, they are called as ismini, hidden_trks respectively.
  7231                                  ;
  7232                                  ; **domini will use the same routine in sethard routine after label set2 to
  7233                                  ;   save coding.
  7234                                  ;
  7235                                  ; **drvmax determined in dohard routine will be used for the next
  7236                                  ;   available logical mini disk drive number.
  7237                                  ;
  7238                                  ; input: drvmax, dskdrvs
  7239                                  ;
  7240                                  ; output: minidisk installed. bdsm table established and installed to bds.
  7241                                  ;	  end_of_bdsm - ending offset address of bdsm.
  7242                                  ;
  7243                                  ; called modules:
  7244                                  ;		  getboot
  7245                                  ;		  find_mini_partition (new), xinstall_bds (new), M038
  7246                                  ;
  7247                                  ;		  setmini (new, it will use set2 routine)
  7248                                  ;
  7249                                  ; variables used: end_of_bdsm
  7250                                  ;		  rom_minidisk_num
  7251                                  ;		  mini_hdlim, mini_seclim
  7252                                  ;		  BDS_STRUC, start_bds
  7253                                  ;

  7255                                  
  7256                                  		; 18/12/2023
  7257                                  		; 19/10/2022
  7258                                  domini:
  7259 00001F51 8A36[F715]              		mov	dh, [hnum]	; get number of hardfiles
  7260                                  		; 10/12/2022
  7261 00001F55 20F6                    		and	dh, dh
  7262                                  		;cmp	dh, 0
  7263 00001F57 742E                    		jz	short dominiret	; no hard file?	then exit.
  7264 00001F59 B280                    		mov	dl, 80h		; start	with hardfile 80h
  7265                                  domini_loop:				
  7266 00001F5B 52                      		push	dx
  7267 00001F5C 8816[F615]              		mov	[rom_minidisk_num], dl
  7268 00001F60 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  7269 00001F62 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  7270                                  					; DL = drive number
  7271                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  7272                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  7273                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  7274                                  		
  7275                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  7276                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:2B36h

  7278                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  7279                                  		;mov	al, dh
  7280 00001F64 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
  7281 00001F66 88F0                    		mov	al, dh	; <= 255
  7282 00001F68 40                      		inc	ax	; (0FFh -> 100h)
  7283 00001F69 A3[FC15]                		mov	[mini_hdlim], ax ; # of heads
  7284                                  		;and	cl, 3Fh
  7285                                  		;mov	al, cl

  7288 00001F6E 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh
  7289 00001F71 A3[FE15]                		mov	[mini_seclim], ax ; # of sectors/track
  7290

  7292                                  		;push	es ; * ; not necessary
  7293 00001F74 8A16[F615]              		mov	dl, [rom_minidisk_num]
  7294 00001F78 E8B0FB                  		call	getboot		; read master boot record into
  7295                                  					; initbootsegment:bootbias
  7296 00001F7B 7203                    		jc	short domininext
  7297 00001F7D E80800                  		call	find_mini_partition
  7298                                  domininext:

  7300 00001F80 5A                      		pop	dx

  7303 00001F85 75D4                    		jnz	short domini_loop
  7304                                  dominiret:
