  9575                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9576                                  
  9577                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9578                                  
  9579                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9580                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9581                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9582                                  ;
  9583                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9584                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9585                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9586                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9587                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9588                                  ;
  9589                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9590                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9591                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9592                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9593                                  
  9594                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9595 000004CE E84A00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9596 000004D1 8B36[E904]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9597                                  
  9598                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9599                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9600                                  ;
  9601                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9602                                  ;	       ----------------
  9603                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9604                                  ;
  9605                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9606                                  ;
  9607                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9608                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9609                                  ;		1,193,180
  9610                                  ;
  9611                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9612                                  ;
  9613                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9614                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9615                                  ;		59,659
  9616                                  ;
  9617                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9618                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9619                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9620                                  ;
  9621                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9622                                  ; multiply by 5
  9623                                  
  9624 000004D5 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9625 000004D7 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9626                                  					; multiply by 5
  9627 000004D9 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9628 000004DB D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9629 000004DD D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9630 000004DF D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9631 000004E1 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9632 000004E3 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9633 000004E5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9634                                  
  9635                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9636                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9637                                  
  9638 000004E6 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9639 000004E9 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9640                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9641                                  
  9642                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9643                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9644 000004EB 93                      		xchg	bx, ax
  9645 000004EC 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9646 000004EE F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9647                                  
  9648                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9649                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9650                                  
  9651 000004F0 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9652 000004F2 B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		; extract 1/100's
  9653                                  
  9654                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9655                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9656                                  
  9657 000004F5 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9658 000004F7 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9659 000004FA 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9660 000004FC 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9661                                  noadj:					
  9662 000004FF F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9663 00000500 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9664                                  
  9665                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9666                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9667                                  
  9668 00000502 D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9669 00000504 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9670 00000506 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9671                                  		;mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9672                                  		; 20/12/2023
  9673 00000508 B13C                    		mov	cl, 60
  9674 0000050A F7F1                    		div	cx
  9675 0000050C 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9676 0000050E F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9677 00000510 86E0                    		xchg	al, ah
  9678                                  
  9679                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9680                                  
  9681                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9682                                  		;push	ax
  9683                                  		;mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9684 00000512 96                      		xchg	ax, si
  9685 00000513 AB                      		stosw
  9686                                  		;pop	ax
  9687 00000514 96                      		xchg	ax, si		; al = hours, ah = minutes
  9688 00000515 AB                      		stosw
  9689 00000516 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9690 00000518 AB                      		stosw
  9691 00000519 F8                      		clc			; [es:di] = count of days since 1-1-80
  9692                                  					;   [es:di+2] = hours
  9693                                  					;   [es:di+3] = minutes
  9694                                  					;   [es:di+4] = seconds
  9695                                  					;   [es:di+5] = hundredths of seconds
  9696 0000051A C3                      		retn
  9697                                  
  9698                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9699                                  
  9700                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9701                                  
  9702                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9703                                  ;
  9704                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9705                                  ;
  9706                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9707                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9708                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9709                                  ;
  9710                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9711                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9712                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9713                                  ;			else
  9714                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9715                                  ;		}
  9716                                  ;
  9717                                  ; USES : AX
  9718                                  ;
  9719                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9720                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9721                                  ;
  9722                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9723                                  
  9724                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9725                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9726 0000051B 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9727 0000051D CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9728                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9729                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9730                                  					; midnight
  9731                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9732                                  		; 20/12/2023
  9733 0000051F 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9734 00000521 3826[EB04]              		cmp	byte [t_switch], ah ; 0
  9735                                  		;cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9736 00000525 7505                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9737                                  		;xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9738                                  					; and not flag
  9739 00000527 0106[E904]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9740 0000052B C3                      		retn
  9741                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9742                                  
  9743                                  inc_case:
  9744 0000052C 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9745 0000052E 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9746 00000530 FF06[E904]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9747                                  no_rollover:
  9748 00000534 C3                      		retn
  9749

  9777                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9778                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9779                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9780                                  
  9781                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9782                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9783                                  
  9784                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9785                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9786                                  
  9787                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9788                                  
  9789                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9790                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9791                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9792                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9793                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9794                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9795                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9796                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9797                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9798                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9799                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9800                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9801                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9802                                  
  9803                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9804                                  
  9805                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9806                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9807                                  ;
  9808                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9809                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9810                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9811                                  ;   else
  9812                                  ;	set slow = value
  9813                                  ;   ...
  9814                                  ;*********************************************
  9815                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9816                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9817                                  ;*	 use slow
  9818                                  ;*   else
  9819                                  ;*	 use fast
  9820                                  ;*********************************************
  9821                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9822                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9823                                  ;	use slow
  9824                                  ;   else
  9825                                  ;	use fast
  9826                                  ;   ...
  9827                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9828                                  ;
  9829                                  ;
  9830                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9831                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9832                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9833                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9834                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9835                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9836                                  
  9837                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9838                                  
  9839                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9840                                  
  9841                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9842                                  
  9843                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9844                                  ;	command jump table
  9845                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9846                                  
  9847                                  		; 20/12/2023
  9848                                  		;db 0
  9849                                  ; 11/12/2022
  9850                                  %if 0
  9851                                  
  9852                                  dsktbl:		db 26			; 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  9853                                  					; ((dtbl_siz-1)/2) ; this is the size of the table ; 26
  9854                                  		dw 1742h		; dsk_init
  9855                                  		dw 4EBh			; media_chk
  9856                                  		dw 592h			; get_bpb
  9857                                  		dw 0D5h			; bc_cmderr
  9858                                  		dw 857h			; dsk_read
  9859                                  		dw 83Dh			; x_bus_exit
  9860                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9861                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9862                                  		dw 849h			; dsk_writ
  9863                                  		dw 841h			; dsk_writv
  9864                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9865                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9866                                  		dw 0D5h			; bc_cmderr

  9917                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9918                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9919                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9920                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  9921                                  ;
  9922                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.

  9932 00000577 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh

  9943                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9944                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9945                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9946                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed

 10033                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10034                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
 10035                                  ; drive.
 10036                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
 10037                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
 10038                                  ; returns in si:
 10039                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
 10040                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
 10041                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
 10042                                  ;
 10043                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
 10044                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10045                                  
 10046                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10047                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
 10048 000005F0 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
 10049 000005F3 E825FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
 10050 000005F6 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 10051                                  					; get stored time
 10052 000005FA 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
 10053 000005FC 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 10054 00000600 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
 10055                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10056                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0646h
 10057                                  		;mov	al, [accesscount]
 10058 00000602 7515                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
 10059 00000604 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
 10060 00000606 750C                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
 10061                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10062                                  		;inc	al
 10063                                  		;cmp	al, 5
 10064                                  		;;inc	byte [accesscount]
 10065                                  		;;cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
 10066                                  		;			; if count is less than threshold, ok
 10067                                  		;jb	short timecheck_ret
 10068                                  		;;dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
 10069                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10070                                  		;dec	al
 10071                                  		;jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
 10072                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10073 00000608 803E[1D01]04            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 4
 10074 0000060D 730A                    		jnb	short timecheck_unk
 10075 0000060F FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
 10076 00000613 C3                      		retn
 10077                                  
 10078                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10079                                  
 10080                                  timepassed:

 10082                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
 10083 00000617 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
 10084                                  
 10085                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.

 10168                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 10169                                  ; clear ids in bds table. only applied for floppies.
 10170                                  ;input:  es:di -> bds table
 10171                                  ;	assumes ds: -> Bios_Data
 10172                                  ;output: volid set to "NO NAME    "
 10173                                  ;	 vol_serial set to 0.
 10174                                  ;	 filesys_id set to "FAT12   " or "FAT16   "
 10175                                  ;	   depending on the flag fatsize in bds.
 10176                                  ;
 10177                                  ;	trashes si, cx

 10179                                  
 10180                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11

 10199                                  		; merging them... jgl

 10209                                  		
 10210                                  		; 11/09/2023 (BugFix, DI is not start addr of BDS structure here)
 10211                                  		;;test	byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbig
 10212                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh)
 10213                                  		;test	byte [es:di+1Fh], 40h
 10214                                  
 10215                                  			; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
 10216                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
 10217                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
 10218                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
 10219                                  			; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
 10220                                  			; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!?
 10221                                  			;
 10222                                  			; Correct Code:
 10223                                  			; ;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig
 10224                                  			; 11/09/2023
 10225                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
 10226                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
 10227                                  			;
 10228                                  			; Same BUG is existing in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:06C3h
 10229                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
 10230                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023)
 10231                                  			;
 10232                                  			; (Why this bug did not affect MSDOS and PCDOS 7.x applications:
 10233                                  			; 'clear_ids' is used for floppy disks only and the default
 10234                                  			; option of 'clear_ids' is FAT12 volid and filesys_id text
 10235                                  			; when the flag bit has wrong value for FAT16/40h or FAT32/20h.)
 10236                                  
 10237 0000067D A840                    		test	al, 40h ; * 
 10238

 10258                                  
 10259                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10260                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
 10261                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
 10262                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
 10263                                  ;	    for all other cases,
 10264                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
 10265                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
 10266                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
 10267                                  ;
 10268                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
 10269                                  ;
 10270                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
 10271                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
 10272                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
 10273                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
 10274                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
 10275                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
 10276                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
 10277                                  ;
 10278                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
 10279                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
 10280                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
 10281                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10282                                  
 10283                                  		; 29/12/2023
 10284                                  GetBp:		
 10285                                  		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
 10286                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable

 10477                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10478                                  
 10479                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10480                                  
 10481                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10482                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 10483                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 10484                                  ;
 10485                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 10486                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10487                                  
 10488                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10489                                  
 10490                                  readbootsec:	
 10491 00000740 B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 10492 00000742 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 10493 00000745 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
 10494 00000748 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 10495 0000074A 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 10496                                  
 10497                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 10498                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 10499                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 10500                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 10501                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 10502                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 10503                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 10504                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 10505                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 10506                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 10507                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 10508                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 10509                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 10510                                  		; informations
 10511                                  
 10512                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 10513                                  
 10514                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10515                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10516                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 10517                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 10518                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 10519                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 10520                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 10521                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10522                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10523                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10524                                  
 10525                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 10526 0000074C A0[4E01]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 10527 0000074F 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 10528 00000751 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10529                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 10530 00000753 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 10531 00000755 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10532                                  					; no need for nop
 10533 00000757 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 10534 00000759 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10535 0000075B 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10536 00000760 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10537                                  
 10538                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10539                                  ;
 10540                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 10541                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 10542                                  ;;
 10543                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 10544                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 10545                                  ;;
 10546                                  ;;check_signature:
 10547                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 10548                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 10549                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
 10550                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 10551                                  
 10552                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 10553                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 10554                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 10555                                  
 10556                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10557                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:
 10558 00000762 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10559                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10560 00000765 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10561 00000766 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 10562 00000768 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 10563 0000076A 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10564 0000076B 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10565                                  
 10566                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 10567                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 10568                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 10569                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 10570                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 10571                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 10572                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 10573                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 10574                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 10575                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 10576                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 10577                                  
 10578                                  checksinglesided:
 10579                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10580                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10581                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 10582 0000076D 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 10583 0000076F 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 10584 00000771 A801                    		test	al, 1
 10585 00000773 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 10586 00000775 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 10587 0000077B 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 10588 0000077D 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 10589 00000782 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 10590                                  
 10591                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 10592                                  
 10593                                  mustbeearlier:				
 10594 00000784 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 10595                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10596 00000789 EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 10597                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10598                                  
 10599                                  invalidbootsec:				
 10600 0000078B 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 10601                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10602                                  movbpb_ret:
 10603                                  gooddsk:				
 10604 0000078C F8                      		clc
 10605                                  err_ret:
 10606 0000078D C3                      		retn

 10610                                  ;err_ret:				
 10611                                  		;retn

 10613                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10614                                  
 10615                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10616                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10617                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10618                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10619                                  ;
 10620                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10621                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10622                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10623                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10624                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10625                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10626                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10627                                  
 10628                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10629                                  
 10630                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10631                                  movbpb:	
 10632 0000078E 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10633                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10634                                  					; sectors per unit
 10635 00000792 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10636                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10637                                  					; number of directory entries
 10638 00000796 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10639                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10640                                  					; size of drive
 10641 0000079A 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10642                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10643                                  					; media	descriptor
 10644 0000079E A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10645                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10646                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10647 000007A1 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10648                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10649                                  					; sectors per track
 10650 000007A5 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 10651                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10652                                  					; number of heads
 10653 000007A9 803E[FB04]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 10654 000007AE 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10655 000007B0 E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 10656 000007B3 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 10657 000007B5 C606[FB04]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 10658                                  movbpb_conv:				
 10659 000007BA 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 10660 000007BF 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10661 000007C1 E89511                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 10662                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10663                                  		; cf = 0
 10664                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 10665                                  		;clc
 10666 000007C4 C3                      		retn
 10667                                  
 10668                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10669                                  
 10670                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10671                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10672                                  ;by es:di.
 10673                                  
 10674                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10675                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 10676                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10677                                  ;      the boot record information.
 10678                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 10679                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10680                                  
 10681                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10682                                  mov_media_ids:		
 10683 000007C5 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 10684                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 10685                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 10686 000007CA 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 10687 000007CC 51                      		push	cx
 10688 000007CD 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 10689                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]

 10726                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10727                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10728                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10729                                  ; output:
 10730                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10731                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit

 10739                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2

 10741 00000802 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret

 10746                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10747                                  
 10748                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10749                                  
 10750                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10751                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10752                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10753                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10754                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10755                                  ;		dh has head
 10756                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10757                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10758                                  ;
 10759                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10760                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10761                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10762                                  ;
 10763                                  ;		carry set
 10764                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10765                                  ;
 10766                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10767                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10768                                  
 10769                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10770                                  
 10771                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10772                                  read_sector:	
 10773 00000807 55                      		push	bp
 10774 00000808 BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10775 0000080B 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10776 0000080F BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10777                                  rd_ret:					
 10778 00000812 06                      		push	es
 10779 00000813 1E                      		push	ds
 10780 00000814 07                      		pop	es
 10781 00000815 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10782 00000818 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10783                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10784                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10785                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10786 0000081A 07                      		pop	es
 10787 0000081B 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10788                                  rd_rty:					
 10789 0000081D E86604                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10790 00000820 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10791 00000822 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10792                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10793                                  					; fnon_removable
 10794 00000827 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10795 00000829 803E[2706]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10796 0000082E 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10797 00000830 50                      		push	ax
 10798 00000831 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10799 00000832 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10800                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10801                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10802                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10803                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10804 00000836 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10805 00000838 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10806                                  		; 
 10807 0000083B 1F                      		pop	ds
 10808 0000083C A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10809 0000083F 58                      		pop	ax
 10810                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10811 00000840 06                      		push	es
 10812 00000841 1E                      		push	ds
 10813 00000842 07                      		pop	es
 10814 00000843 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10815 00000846 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10816                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10817                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10818                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10819 00000848 07                      		pop	es
 10820 00000849 9C                      		pushf
 10821 0000084A 803E[2706]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10822 0000084F 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10823 00000851 50                      		push	ax
 10824 00000852 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10825 00000855 1E                      		push	ds
 10826 00000856 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10827 0000085A 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10828 0000085D 1F                      		pop	ds
 10829 0000085E 58                      		pop	ax
 10830                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10831 0000085F 9D                      		popf
 10832 00000860 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10833 00000862 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10834                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10835                                  
 10836                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10837 00000864 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10838                                  					; return error
 10839 00000866 F9                      		stc
 10840                                  
 10841                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10842                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10843                                  
 10844                                  okret2:					
 10845 00000867 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10846 0000086B 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed
 10847 0000086F 26886D46                		mov	[es:di+46h], ch	; [es:di+BDS.track]

 10853 00000878 5D                      		pop	bp

 10878 00000898 7404                    		jz	short exitjx	; watch	out for	wrap
 10879 0000089A 26FF4D20                		dec	word [es:di+20h]
 10880                                  exitjx:					
 10881                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10882                                  		; cf = 0
 10883                                  		;clc		; CF is	already	ZERO here (18/09/2022, MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10884                                  				; (19/07/2019 -	Erdogan	Tan - MSDOS 6.0	IO.SYS - retrodos4.s)
 10885 0000089E C3                      		retn

 10944                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================

 10946                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10947                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10948                                  
 10949                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10950                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines.
 10951                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10952                                  
 10953                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10954                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10955                                  ;
 10956                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 10957                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10958                                  
 10959                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10960                                  checksingle:
 10961 000008C9 50                      		push	ax
 10962 000008CA 53                      		push	bx
 10963 000008CB 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10964                                  
 10965                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10966                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10967                                  
 10968 000008CF F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10969 000008D2 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10970 000008D4 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10971                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10972 000008D7 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10973                                  
 10974                                  
 10975                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10976                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10977                                  
 10978 000008D9 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10979                                  					; get physical drive number
 10980 000008DD 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10981 000008DE 57                      		push	di
 10982 000008DF C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10983                                  scan_list:
 10984 000008E3 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10985 000008E7 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10986 000008E9 B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10987 000008EB 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10988 000008EF 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10989 000008F1 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10990 000008F5 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10991 000008F6 07                      		pop	es
 10992 000008F7 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10993                                  
 10994                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10995                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10996                                  ; in this case.
 10997 000008FB 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10998 00000900 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10999                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 11000 00000902 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 11001 00000907 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 11002 00000909 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 11003                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 11004                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 11005 0000090D 06                      		push	es
 11006 0000090E 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 11007 00000912 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 11008                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 11009                                  					; set up sdsb
 11010 00000916 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 11011 00000917 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 11012                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11013                                  
 11014                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 11015                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 11016                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 11017                                  
 11018                                  not_fsetowner:
 11019 00000919 803E[7800]02            		cmp	byte [single], 2 ; if (single_drive_system)
 11020 0000091E 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 11021 00000920 50                      		push	ax
 11022 00000921 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 11023 00000925 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 11024 00000927 06                      		push	es
 11025 00000928 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 11026 0000092C 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 11027                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 11028                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 11029 00000931 07                      		pop	es
 11030 00000932 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 11031 00000934 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 11032 00000935 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 11033                                  ignore_sdsb:
 11034 00000937 E8490E                  		call	swpdsk
 11035 0000093A EB0B                    		jmp	short singleret
 11036                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11037                                  
 11038                                  scan_skip:
 11039 0000093C 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]			
 11040                                  		;les	di, es:[di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 11041                                  					; go to	next bds
 11042 0000093F 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 11043 00000942 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 11044 00000944 F9                      		stc
 11045 00000945 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 11046 00000946 07                      		pop	es
 11047                                  singleret:
 11048 00000947 5B                      		pop	bx
 11049 00000948 58                      		pop	ax
 11050 00000949 C3                      		retn

 11074                                  ; 15/10/2022
 11075                                  
 11076                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11077                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 11078                                  ;
 11079                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 11080                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 11081                                  ;	cx = sector count
 11082                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 11083                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 11084                                  ;	ds = cs
 11085                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 11086                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 11087                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 11088                                  ;
 11089                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 11090                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 11091                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11092                                  
 11093                                  diskrd:	
 11094                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 11095                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11096 0000094E C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 11097                                  
 11098                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11099                                  
 11100                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11101                                  diskio:
 11102 00000953 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 11103 00000955 8C06[2605]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 11104 00000959 E80EFC                  		call	SetDrive
 11105 0000095C 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 11106 00000960 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 11107                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 11108 00000963 E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 11109                                  
 11110                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 11111                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 11112                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 11113                                  
 11114 00000965 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 11115                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 11116                                  					; unformatted_media
 11117 0000096A 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive
 11118 0000096C 890E[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], cx	; save sector count
 11119 00000970 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 11120                                  
 11121                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 11122                                  
 11123 00000974 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 11124 00000976 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 11125 00000978 01CA                    		add	dx, cx
 11126                                  		;adc	si, 0
 11127                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 11128 0000097A D1D6                    		rcl	si, 1
 11129 0000097C 26837D0E00              		cmp	word [es:di+0Eh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 11130                                  					; 32 bit sector ?
 11131 00000981 740C                    		jz	short sanity32
 11132                                  		;cmp	si, 0
 11133                                  		; 02/09/2023
 11134 00000983 09F6                    		or	si, si
 11135 00000985 751A                    		jnz	short baddrive
 11136 00000987 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 11137 0000098B 7714                    		ja	short baddrive
 11138 0000098D EB16                    		jmp	short sanityok
