 13629                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13630                                  ;	GetMediaSenseStatus
 13631                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13632                                  ;
 13633                                  ; FUNCTION: Will return the type of diskette media in the specified DOS
 13634                                  ;	    diskette drive and whether the media is the default type
 13635                                  ;	    for that drive. (default type means the max size for that
 13636                                  ;	    drive)
 13637                                  ;
 13638                                  ; INPUT :   ES:DI -> BDS table
 13639                                  ; OUTPUT:   If carry clear
 13640                                  ;	    DS:BX -> Updated IOCtlPacket
 13641                                  ;
 13642                                  ;			 Special Function at offset 0:
 13643                                  ;				0	- Media detected is not default type
 13644                                  ;				1	- Media detected is default type
 13645                                  ;
 13646                                  ;			 Device Type at offset 1:
 13647                                  ;				2       - 720K 3.5" 80 tracks
 13648                                  ;				7	- 1.44M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13649                                  ;				9	- 2.88M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13650                                  ;
 13651                                  ; Error Codes returned in AX if carry set:
 13652                                  ;
 13653                                  ; 8102 - Drive not ready	- No disk is in the drive.
 13654                                  ; 8107 - Unknown media type	- Drive doesn't support this function or
 13655                                  ;				  the media is really unkown, any error
 13656                                  ;				  other than "media not present"
 13657                                  ; 
 13658                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13659                                  
 13660                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13661                                  SenseMediaType:				
 13662 000012D7 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header.
 13663 000012DB C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13664                                  		; 10/10/2022
 13665                                  		;mov	word [bx], 0	; Initialize the 2 packet bytes
 13666 000012DE 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13667 000012E0 8917                    		mov	[bx], dx ; 0
 13668                                  		;
 13669 000012E2 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13670                                  					; Get int 13h drive number from	BDS
 13671                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13672                                  		;xor	dh, dh		; DX = physical	drive number
 13673 000012E6 B420                    		mov	ah, 20h		; Get Media Type function
 13674                                  					; If no	carry media type in AL
 13675 000012E8 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - QCACHE	- DISMOUNT
 13676 000012EA 7216                    		jb	short MediaSenseEr ; error code	in AH
 13677 000012EC FE07                    		inc	byte [bx]	; Signal media type is default (bit 1)
 13678                                  DetermineMediaType:			
 13679 000012EE FEC8                    		dec	al
 13680 000012F0 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; Chk for 720K ie: (3-1) = 2
 13681 000012F2 740A                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13682 000012F4 0404                    		add	al, 4
 13683 000012F6 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7		; Chk for 1.44M ie: (4-1+4) = 7
 13684 000012F8 7404                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13685 000012FA 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9		; Chk for 2.88M	ie: (6-1+4) = 9
 13686 000012FC 7510                    		jnz	short UnknownMediaType ; Just didn't recognize media type
 13687                                  GotMediaType:				
 13688 000012FE 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; Save the return value
 13689                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13690                                  		; cf = 0
 13691                                  		;clc			; Signal success
 13692 00001301 C3                      		retn
 13693                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13694                                  
 13695                                  MediaSenseEr:				
 13696 00001302 80FC32                  		cmp	ah, 32h		; See if not default media error
 13697 00001305 74E7                    		jz	short DetermineMediaType ; Not really an error
 13698 00001307 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; Now assume drive not ready
 13699 00001309 80FC31                  		cmp	ah, 31h		; See if media was present
 13700 0000130C 7402                    		jz	short SenseErrExit ; Return drive not ready
 13701                                  UnknownMediaType:			
 13702 0000130E B007                    		mov	al, 7		; Just don't know the media type
 13703                                  SenseErrExit:				
 13704 00001310 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Signal error return
 13705 00001312 F9                      		stc
 13706 00001313 C3                      		retn
 13707                                  
 13708                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13709                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13710                                  		;db    0
 13711                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13712                                  
 13713                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13714                                  
 13715                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13716                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 13717                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13718                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13719                                  
 13720                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 13721                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 13722                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 13723                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 13724                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 13725                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 13726                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 13727                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 13728                                  ;
 13729                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 13730                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 13731                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 13732                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 13733                                  ;
 13734                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 13735                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 13736                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 13737                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 13738                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 13739                                  ;
 13740                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 13741                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 13742                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 13743                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 13744                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 13745                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 13746                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 13747                                  
 13748                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 13749                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 13750                                  
 13751                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 13752                                  
 13753                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 13754 00001314 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 13755 00001317 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 13756 00001319 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 13757 0000131C 7431                    		jz	short mine
 13758                                  
 13759                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 13760                                  
 13761 0000131E 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 13762 00001321 746C                    		jz	short win386call
 13763 00001323 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT
 13764 00001326 7503                    		jnz	short i2f_handler_iret
 13765 00001328 E99700                  		jmp	handle_multmult
 13766                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13767                                  
 13768                                  i2f_handler_iret:			
 13769 0000132B CF                      		iret
 13770                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13771                                  
 13772                                  int2f_replace_int13:
 13773 0000132C 50                      		push	ax	; free up a register for caller's ds
 13774 0000132D 8CD8                    		mov	ax, ds	; then we can use ds: -> Bios_Data
 13775                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h] ; 15/10/2022	
 13776                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13777                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13778 0000132F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
 13779                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13780                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13	; save old value of old13 and
 13781                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13+2	; orig13 so that we can
 13782                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13	; return them to caller
 13783                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13+2
 13784                                  		
 13785                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13786                                  		;push	word [Orig13]
 13787 00001334 FF36[B600]              		push	word [Orig13+2]
 13788                                  		;push	word [Old13]
 13789 00001338 FF36[0801]              		push	word [Old13+2]
 13790                                  
 13791                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13, dx	; orig13 := addr. of new int_13
 13792                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13+2, ax
 13793                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13, bx	; old13 := addr. of new boot_13
 13794                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13+2, es
 13795                                  		
 13796                                  		;mov	[Orig13], dx
 13797                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13798 0000133C 8716[B400]              		xchg	dx, [Orig13]
 13799 00001340 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
 13800                                  		;mov	[Old13], bx
 13801                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13802 00001343 871E[0601]              		xchg	bx, [Old13]
 13803 00001347 8C06[0801]              		mov	[Old13+2], es
 13804                                  
 13805 0000134B 07                      		pop	es			; es:bx := old old13 vector
 13806                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13807                                  		;pop	bx
 13808 0000134C 1F                      		pop	ds			; ds:dx := old orig13 vector
 13809                                  		;pop	dx ; 02/09/2023
 13810 0000134D 58                      		pop	ax
 13811                                  i2f_iret:
 13812 0000134E CF                      		iret

 14012                                  
 14013                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14014                                  
 14015                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14016                                  ;
 14017                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 14018                                  ;
 14019                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 14020                                  ;							seg ffff )
 14021                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 14022                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 14023                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 14024                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 14025                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 14026                                  ;
 14027                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 14028                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 14029                                  ;
 14030                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14031                                  
 14032                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14033                                  HMAPtr:
 14034 0000140F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14035                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14036 00001414 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14037                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14038 00001418 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14039 0000141B 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14040 0000141D 803E[9208]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 14041                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 14042 00001422 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14043 00001424 FF1E[8E08]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14044                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14045 00001428 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14046                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14047                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 14048 0000142C C3                      		retn
 14049                                  
 14050                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14051                                  
 14052                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14053                                  
 14054                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 14055                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 14056                                  
 14057                                  move_sector:
 14058                                  
 14059                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 14060                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 14061                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 14062                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 14063                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 14064                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 14065                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 14066                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 14067                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 14068                                  ;
 14069                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 14070                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 14071                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 14072                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 14073                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14074                                  
 14075 0000142D FC                      		cld
 14076 0000142E 51                      		push	cx
 14077 0000142F B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14078 00001432 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14079 00001436 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14080 00001438 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14081 0000143C 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14082 0000143E F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14083 00001440 59                      		pop	cx
 14084 00001441 C3                      		retn
 14085                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14086                                  
 14087                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14088 00001442 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14089 00001444 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14090 00001446 59                      		pop	cx
 14091 00001447 C3                      		retn
 14092                                  
 14093                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14094                                  
 14095                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14096                                  
 14097                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14098                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14099                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14100                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14101                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14102                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14103                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14104                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14105                                  ;
 14106                                  ; input conditions:
 14107                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14108                                  ;
 14109                                  ; output:
 14110                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14111                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14112                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14113                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14114                                  
 14115                                  check_wrap:	
 14116 00001448 50                      		push	ax
 14117 00001449 53                      		push	bx
 14118 0000144A 06                      		push	es
 14119 0000144B 57                      		push	di
 14120 0000144C E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14121 0000144F 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14122                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14123 00001451 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14124                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14125 00001456 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14126 00001458 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14127 0000145C 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14128 0000145E 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14129 00001461 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14130 00001463 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14131 00001465 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14132                                  
 14133                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14134                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14135                                  
 14136 00001467 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14137 00001469 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14138                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14139 0000146B 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14140 0000146C 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14141                                  					; if on	boundary
 14142                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14143                                  not_on_bound:
 14144 0000146E 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14145 00001471 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14146 00001473 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14147 00001475 40                      		inc	ax
 14148 00001476 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14149 00001478 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14150                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14151 0000147B 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14152 0000147F 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14153                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14154                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14155 00001481 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14156 00001483 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14157 00001484 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14158                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14159 00001486 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14160                                  
 14161                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14162                                  
 14163 00001488 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14164 0000148A 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14165 0000148C 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14166                                  
 14167                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14168                                  
 14169 0000148E 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14170 00001490 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14171 00001492 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14172                                  no_head_bound:				
 14173 00001493 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14174 00001495 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14175 00001496 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14176 00001498 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14177 0000149A 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14178 0000149C 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14179 0000149F B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14180 000014A1 86D9                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14181 000014A3 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14182 000014A5 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14183 000014A7 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14184 000014A9 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14185 000014AB 86CB                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14186 000014AD 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14187                                  no_wrap:				
 14188 000014AF F8                      		clc
 14189 000014B0 5F                      		pop	di
 14190 000014B1 07                      		pop	es
 14191 000014B2 5B                      		pop	bx
 14192 000014B3 58                      		pop	ax
 14193 000014B4 C3                      		retn
 14194                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14195                                  
 14196                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14197 000014B5 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14198 000014B7 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14199 000014B9 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14200                                  
 14201                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14202                                  
 14203                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14204                                  
 14205                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14206                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14207                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14208                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14209                                  ;
 14210                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14211                                  
 14212                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14213                                  find_bds:	
 14214 000014BB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14215                                  fbds_1:					
 14216 000014BF 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14217 000014C3 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14218 000014C5 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14219                                  					; go to next bds
 14220 000014C8 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14221 000014CB 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14222 000014CD F9                      		stc
 14223                                  fdbs_2:					
 14224 000014CE C3                      		retn
 14225                                  
 14226                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14227                                  
 14228                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14229                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14230                                  doint:
 14231                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14232 000014CF 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14233                                  					; get physical drive number
 14234                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14235                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14236                                  		
 14237 000014D2 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14238 000014D4 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14239 000014D6 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14240                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14241 000014D8 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14242                                  					; get request code
 14243                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14244 000014DB FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14245                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14246 000014DE 9D                      		popf
 14247                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14248                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14249 000014DF 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14250                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14251                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14252 000014E4 9C                      		pushf
 14253                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14254 000014E5 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14255                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14256                                  dointdone:				
 14257 000014E8 C3                      		retn
 14258                                  
 14259                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14260                                  
 14261                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14262                                  
 14263                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14264                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14265                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14266                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14267                                  ;
 14268                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14269                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14270                                  ;
 14271                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14272                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14273                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14274                                  
 14275                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14276                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14277                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14278                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14279                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14280                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14281                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14282                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14283                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14284                                  ;end struc
 14285                                  
 14286                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14287                                  
 14288                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14289                                  ;	ah = function
 14290                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14291                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14292                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14293                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14294                                  ;   output conditions:
 14295                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14296                                  
 14297                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14298                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14299                                  ;
 14300                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14301                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14302                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14303                                  
 14304                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14305                                  
 14306                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14307                                  
 14308 000014E9 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14309                                  
 14310                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14311                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14312                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14313                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14314                                  
 14315                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14316                                  
 14317                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14318                                  
 14319                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14320                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14321                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14322                                  
 14323                                  format_special_stuff:
 14324 000014ED 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 14325 000014F2 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14326 000014F4 53                      		push	bx
 14327 000014F5 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14328 000014F8 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14329 000014FB 5B                      		pop	bx
 14330 000014FC EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14331                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14332                                  
 14333                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14334                                  
 14335                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14336                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14337                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14338                                  
 14339                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14340                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 14341 000014FE 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14342 00001500 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 14343 00001502 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 14344 00001503 51                      		push	cx
 14345 00001504 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 14346 00001506 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 14347 00001508 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 14348 0000150A 8406[2005]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 14349 0000150E 59                      		pop	cx
 14350 0000150F 58                      		pop	ax
 14351 00001510 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14352                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14353 00001512 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14354 00001513 06                      		push	es
 14355                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14356 00001514 2EC41E[E914]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 14357                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14358                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 14359 00001519 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 14360 0000151B 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 14361 0000151E 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 14362                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14363                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14364 00001522 07                      		pop	es
 14365 00001523 5B                      		pop	bx
 14366 00001524 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14367                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14368                                  
 14369                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14370                                  
 14371                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14372                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14373                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14374                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14375                                  
 14376                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 14377 00001526 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14378                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14379 0000152B 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 14380 0000152D 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 14381                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14382 00001532 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14383                                  ps2_30_problem:
 14384 00001534 50                      		push	ax
 14385 00001535 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14386                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14387                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14388 00001537 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14389                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14390                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14391 0000153C 58                      		pop	ax
 14392 0000153D EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14393                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14394                                  
 14395                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14396                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14397                                  
 14398                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14399                                  
 14400                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14401                                  
 14402                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14403                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14404                                  
 14405                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14406 0000153F 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14407                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14408                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 14409 00001540 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14410                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14411                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14412                                  
 14413                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14414                                  
 14415 00001545 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14416 00001548 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14417 0000154B 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14418                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14419                                  format_special_stuff_done:		
 14420 0000154D 803E[2005]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14421 00001552 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14422                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14423                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14424                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 14425 00001554 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14426                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14427                                  		
 14428 00001559 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14429                                  		
 14430 0000155A 803E[2D06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14431                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14432 0000155F 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14433                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14434                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 14435 00001561 9D                      		popf
 14436 00001562 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14437                                  ret_from_i13:
 14438 00001564 1F                      		pop	ds
 14439 00001565 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14440                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14441                                  
 14442                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14443                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14444                                  ; a changeline error.
 14445                                  
 14446                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:
 14447 00001568 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14448                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14449 0000156A 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14450 0000156D 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14451 0000156F 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14452 00001571 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14453 00001573 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14454 00001578 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14455                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14456                                  					; never	would
 14457 0000157A 53                      		push	bx
 14458 0000157B BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14459 0000157E E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14460 00001581 5B                      		pop	bx
 14461                                  int13b:
 14462 00001582 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14463 00001583 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14464                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14465                                  
 14466                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14467                                  
 14468                                  goterr13:
 14469 00001585 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14470 00001588 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14471                                  goterr13_xxxx:
 14472 0000158A 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14473 0000158D 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14474 0000158F 803E[2706]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14475 00001594 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14476                                  
 14477 00001596 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14478                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14479                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14480                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14481 0000159B 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14482                                  
 14483 0000159D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14484                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14485                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14486 0000159F 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14487                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14488                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14489 000015A4 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14490 000015A7 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14491 000015A9 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14492 000015AB 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14493 000015AD 53                      		push	bx
 14494 000015AE 51                      		push	cx
 14495 000015AF 52                      		push	dx
 14496 000015B0 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14497                                  loop_ecc:
 14498 000015B3 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14499                                  
 14500                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14501                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14502                                  ;
 14503                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14504                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14505                                  ; track.
 14506                                  ;
 14507                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14508                                  ; this request.
 14509                                  ;
 14510                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14511                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14512                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14513                                  ;
 14514 000015B6 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14515                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14516                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14517 000015B9 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14518                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14519 000015BE 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14520 000015C0 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14521 000015C3 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14522 000015C5 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14523 000015C8 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14524                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14525                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14526                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14527 000015CA 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14528                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14529                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14530                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14531                                  ok11_op:
 14532 000015CC FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14533 000015D0 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14534 000015D2 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14535                                  					; add 200h to address
 14536 000015D4 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14537 000015D6 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14538 000015D8 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14539                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14540                                  
 14541                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14542                                  
 14543                                  ok11_exit_err:
 14544 000015DA F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14545                                  ok11_exit:
 14546 000015DB 5A                      		pop	dx
 14547 000015DC 59                      		pop	cx
 14548 000015DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 14549 000015DE EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14550                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14551                                  
 14552                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14553                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14554                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14555                                  
 14556                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 14557 000015E0 06                      		push	es
 14558 000015E1 53                      		push	bx
 14559 000015E2 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14560 000015E5 1E                      		push	ds
 14561 000015E6 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14562 000015E7 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14563                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14564                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14565 000015EA 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14566                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14567 000015EF 5B                      		pop	bx
 14568 000015F0 07                      		pop	es
 14569 000015F1 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14570 000015F3 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14571 000015F6 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14572                                  
 14573                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14574                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14575                                  
 14576                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 14577 000015F8 56                      		push	si
 14578 000015F9 57                      		push	di
 14579 000015FA 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14580 000015FC BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14581 000015FF E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14582 00001602 5F                      		pop	di
 14583 00001603 5E                      		pop	si
 14584 00001604 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14585                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14586                                  
 14587                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14588                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14589                                  
 14590                                  gotdmaerr:
 14591 00001606 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14592 00001609 FB                      		sti
 14593 0000160A 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14594 0000160D 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14595                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14596                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14597 0000160F 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14598 00001612 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14599 00001614 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14600 00001617 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14601 00001619 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14602                                  
 14603                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14604                                  
 14605                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14606                                  
 14607 0000161B 52                      		push	dx
 14608 0000161C 51                      		push	cx
 14609 0000161D 53                      		push	bx
 14610 0000161E 50                      		push	ax
 14611 0000161F 55                      		push	bp
 14612 00001620 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14613 00001622 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14614 00001624 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14615 00001626 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14616 00001628 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14617 0000162A D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14618 0000162C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14619 0000162E 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14620                                  
 14621                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14622                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14623                                  
 14624 00001632 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14625 00001634 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14626                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14627                                  
 14628                                  no_skip_first:
 14629 00001637 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14630 00001639 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14631 0000163B 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14632                                  
 14633                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14634                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14635                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14636                                  ;
 14637                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14638                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14639                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14640                                  ; in error.
 14641                                  
 14642 0000163D 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14643 0000163F 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14644                                  
 14645                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14646                                  
 14647 00001641 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14648                                  					; set up head number
 14649 00001644 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14650 00001647 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14651                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14652                                  
 14653                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 14654 0000164A B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14655 0000164C F9                      		stc
 14656 0000164D E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14657                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14658                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14659                                  
 14660                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14661                                  
 14662                                  intverify:
 14663 00001650 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14664 00001651 53                      		push	bx
 14665 00001652 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14666 00001653 07                      		pop	es
 14667                                  dosimple:
 14668 00001654 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14669                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14670                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14671                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14672 00001657 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14673                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14674 0000165C 5B                      		pop	bx
 14675 0000165D 07                      		pop	es
 14676 0000165E E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14677                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14678                                  
 14679                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14680                                  
 14681                                  intformat:
 14682 00001661 06                      		push	es
 14683 00001662 53                      		push	bx
 14684 00001663 56                      		push	si
 14685 00001664 57                      		push	di
 14686 00001665 1E                      		push	ds
 14687                                  
 14688                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14689                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14690                                  
 14691 00001666 06                      		push	es
 14692 00001667 1E                      		push	ds
 14693 00001668 07                      		pop	es
 14694 00001669 1F                      		pop	ds
 14695 0000166A 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14696 0000166C BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14697 0000166F E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14698 00001672 1F                      		pop	ds
 14699 00001673 5F                      		pop	di
 14700 00001674 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14701 00001675 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14702                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14703                                  
 14704                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14705                                  ; the first block.
 14706                                  ;
 14707                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14708                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14709                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14710                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14711                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14712                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14713                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14714                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14715                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14716                                  
 14717                                  doblock:
 14718                                  
 14719                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14720                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14721                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14722                                  				
 14723 00001677 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14724                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14725 0000167A 51                      		push	cx
 14726 0000167B 06                      		push	es
 14727 0000167C 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14728                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14729 0000167D E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14730 00001680 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14731                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14732 00001684 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14733                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14734 00001689 5F                      		pop	di
 14735 0000168A 07                      		pop	es
 14736 0000168B 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14737 0000168D 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14738 0000168F B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14739 00001691 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14740                                  doblockflop:
 14741 00001693 59                      		pop	cx
 14742                                  doblockcontinue:
 14743 00001694 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14744 00001696 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14745 00001698 50                      		push	ax
 14746 00001699 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14747 0000169B EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14748                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14749                                  
 14750                                  doblocklast:
 14751 0000169D 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14752 0000169F 50                      		push	ax
 14753                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 14754 000016A0 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14755 000016A3 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14756 000016A5 58                      		pop	ax
 14757 000016A6 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14758                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14759 000016A9 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14760 000016AB 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14761 000016AD 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14762 000016AF 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14763 000016B1 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14764                                  					; then we are done already.
 14765 000016B3 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14766                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14767 000016B5 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14768 000016B8 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14769                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14770                                  
 14771                                  bufferx:
 14772 000016BA 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14773                                  					; set up head number
 14774                                  buffer:
 14775 000016BD 53                      		push	bx
 14776 000016BE 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14777 000016C1 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14778 000016C4 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14779                                  
 14780                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14781                                  
 14782 000016C6 06                      		push	es
 14783 000016C7 1E                      		push	ds
 14784 000016C8 56                      		push	si
 14785 000016C9 57                      		push	di
 14786 000016CA 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14787 000016CB 06                      		push	es
 14788 000016CC 1F                      		pop	ds
 14789 000016CD 07                      		pop	es
 14790 000016CE BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14791 000016D1 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14792 000016D2 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14793 000016D4 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14794 000016D7 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14795                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14796 000016D8 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14797 000016D9 5E                      		pop	si
 14798 000016DA 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14799                                  
 14800                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14801                                  
 14802 000016DB B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14803                                  					; get drive number
 14804 000016DD 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14805 000016E0 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14806                                  					;
 14807                                  					; ah is	function
 14808                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14809                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14810                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14811                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14812                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14813 000016E3 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14814 000016E6 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14815 000016E7 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14816 000016E9 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14817                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14818                                  
 14819                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14820                                  
 14821                                  doread:
 14822 000016EB 06                      		push	es
 14823 000016EC 53                      		push	bx
 14824 000016ED 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14825 000016EE 07                      		pop	es
 14826 000016EF BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14827 000016F2 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14828 000016F4 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14829                                  					; get drive number
 14830 000016F7 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14831                                  					; ah = function
 14832                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14833                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14834                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14835 000016FA E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14836 000016FD 5B                      		pop	bx
 14837 000016FE 07                      		pop	es
 14838 000016FF 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14839 00001701 56                      		push	si
 14840 00001702 57                      		push	di
 14841 00001703 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14842 00001705 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14843 00001708 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14844 0000170B 5F                      		pop	di
 14845 0000170C 5E                      		pop	si
 14846                                  
 14847                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14848                                  
 14849                                  dotail:
 14850 0000170D 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14851 0000170E 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14852 00001711 41                      		inc	cx
 14853 00001712 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14854 00001715 F8                      		clc
 14855 00001716 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14856 00001718 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14857                                  
 14858                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14859                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14860                                  
 14861 0000171A 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14862 0000171D E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14863 00001720 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14864                                  
 14865                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14866                                  
 14867                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14868                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14869                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14870                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14871                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14872                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14873                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14874                                  
 14875                                  bad13:
 14876 00001723 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14877 00001725 5D                      		pop	bp
 14878 00001726 5B                      		pop	bx
 14879 00001727 5B                      		pop	bx
 14880 00001728 59                      		pop	cx
 14881 00001729 5A                      		pop	dx
 14882 0000172A 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14883 0000172C E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14884                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14885                                  
 14886                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:
 14887 0000172F E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14888                                  
 14889                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14890                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14891                                  		;db 	0
 14892                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14893                                  
 14894                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 14904                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h

 14906 00001736 BF[7606]                		mov	di, dskdrvs

 14913                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14914                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14915                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14916                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14917                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14918                                  
 14919                                  install_bds:
 14920 0000173E 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14921 0000173F BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14922                                  
 14923                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14924                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14925                                  loop_next_bds:
 14926 00001742 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14927                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14928 00001744 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14929 00001748 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14930                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14931 0000174B 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14932 0000174D B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14933 0000174F 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14934                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14935 00001753 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14936 00001756 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14937                                  					; we don't own it
 14938 0000175B 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14939                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14940 0000175E 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14941 00001761 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14942                                  next_bds:
 14943                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14944 00001765 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14945 00001768 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14946                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14947                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14948 0000176A 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14949 0000176C 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14950                                  					; install bds
 14951 0000176F 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14952 00001771 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14953                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14954                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14955 00001774 1F                      		pop	ds

 14990                                  swpdsk:		
 14991 00001783 F606[6608]01            		test	byte [IsWin386], 1			
 14992                                  		;test	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Is win386 present?
 14993 00001788 7405                    		jz	short no_win386	; no, skip SetFocus
 14994
