 19899                                  	;retn
 19900                                  	; 18/12/2022
 19901 0000093A 731C                    	jnc	short LoadDosHi_ok
 19902                                  LdngLo:

 19904                                  	;push	cs

 19909 0000093E BA[E408]                	mov	dx,DOSLOMSG		; inform user that we are
 19910 00000941 CD21                    	int	21h			; loading low
 19911

 19913                                  	; actually move the dos, and reinitialize it.

 19941                                  ;
 19942                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 19943                                  ;
 19944                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 19945                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 19946                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 19947                                  ;
 19948                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 19949                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 19950                                  ; 
 19951                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19952                                  
 19953                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19954                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)
 19955                                  TryToMovDOSHi:
 19956                                  	; 11/12/2022

 19958                                  	; ds = cs

 19960 0000095C 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 19961                                  
 19962                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 19963                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19964                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 19965                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19966                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19967                                  	; ds = cs
 19968 0000095E 8E06[7302]              	mov	es,[CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]
 19969                                  ;else
 19970                                  ;	..
 19971                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 19972                                  
 19973                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19974                                  	; ds = cs

 19990                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.

 20003 00000974 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh

 20020

 20322                                  AllocMemForDOS:
 20323                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20324                                  	; 14/05/2019

 20326                                  	; ds = cs
 20327                                  	;mov	ax,BCode_end
 20328                                  	;sub	ax,BCode_start		; BIOS code size
 20329                                  	; 23/10/2022

 20331                                  					; 30/12/2022

 20333                                  	; 09/12/2022

 20338                                  	; 11/12/2022

 20340 000009D6 0306[8102]              	add	ax,[lo_doscod_size]
 20341 000009DA 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 20342 000009DD E86302                  	call	off_to_para			; convert to para
 20343                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20344                                  	; 14/05/2019
 20345                                  	;inc	ax ; + 1 paragraph for MCB
 20346 000009E0 09DB                    	or	bx,bx				; M012
 20347 000009E2 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax				;  can we use int 21 for alloc
 20348 000009E4 741A                    	jz	short update_arena		; M012
 20349 000009E6 B448                    	mov	ah,48h				; request DOS
 20350 000009E8 CD21                    	int	21h
 20351 000009EA 7250                    	jc	short FatalErr			; IF ERR WE ARE HOSED
 20352                                   	; 23/10/2022
 20353                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)
 20354 000009EC 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				; Take care ORG 30h of
 20355                                  						;  BIOS code
 20356 000009EF 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20357                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.OWNER],08h	; mark it as system
 20358                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.NAME],'SC'	;  code area
 20359                                  	; 14/05/2019
 20360                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],08h	; mark it as system
 20361                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'	;  code area
 20362                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20363 000009F1 26C70621000800          	mov	word [es:20h+1],08h		; mark it as system
 20364 000009F8 26C70628005343          	mov	word [es:20h+8],'SC'		;  code area
 20365                                  
 20366 000009FF C3                      	retn
 20367                                  
 20368                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 20369                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 20370                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 20371                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 20372                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 20373                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 20374                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 20375                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 20376                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 20377                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 20378                                  ;	  stub will go.

 20395                                  						;  before sysvar

 20400 00000A13 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error

 20445                                  ;
 20446                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 20447                                  ;
 20448                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20449                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20450                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20451                                  ;
 20452                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20453                                  ;
 20454                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20455                                  
 20456                                  AllocHMA:
 20457                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 20458                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20459                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20460                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20461                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 20462                                  
 20463                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 20464                                  ;
 20465                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 20466                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 20467                                  ;	push	ax
 20468                                  ;	popf
 20469                                  ;	pushf
 20470                                  ;	pop	ax
 20471                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 20472                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 20473                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 20474                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 20475                                  
 20476                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20477                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)

 20492                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 20493

 20615                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20616                                  ;
 20617                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20618                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20619                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20620                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20621                                  ;
 20622                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20623                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20624                                  ;
 20625                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20626                                  
 20627                                  StartVDHead:
 20628                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20629                                  
 20630 00000AC0 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20631 00000AC4 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20632 00000AC6 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20633 00000AC8 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20634 00000ACA 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20635                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20636 00000ACB 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20637                                  VDiskSig1:
 20638 00000AD2 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20639                                  
 20640                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20641                                  
 20642 00000AD7 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20643                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20644 00000ADD 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20645 00000AEC 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20646 00000AEE 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20647                                  VDInt19:
 20648 00000AEF EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20649                                  OldVDInt19:
 20650 00000AF0 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20651                                  
 20652                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20653                                  
 20654                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20655 00000AF4 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20656                                  VDiskSig2:
 20657 00000AF7 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20658                                  
 20659                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20660                                  
 20661 00000AFC 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20662 00000AFF 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20663 00000B01 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20664 00000B02 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20665 00000B04 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20666 00000B05 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20667 00000B07 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20668 00000B09 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20669 00000B0A 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20670 00000B0C 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20671 00000B0E 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20672 00000B10 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20673 00000B12 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20674                                  
 20675                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte

 20677                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20678                                  ;
 20679                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20680                                  ;
 20681                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20682                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20683                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20684                                  ;
 20685                                  ; Inputs : None
 20686                                  ;
 20687                                  ; Outputs : None
 20688                                  ;
 20689                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20690                                  ;
 20691                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20692                                  
 20693                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20694                                  
 20695                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20696 00000B14 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20697 00000B16 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20698                                  
 20699                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20700                                  
 20701                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20702 00000B18 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20703                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20704 00000B1B 2EA3[F00A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20705 00000B1F A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20706                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20707 00000B22 2EA3[F20A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20708                                  
 20709                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20710                                  
 20711 00000B26 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20712                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20713                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20714 00000B28 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20715 00000B2B CD21                    	int	21h
 20716                                  
 20717                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20718                                  
 20719 00000B2D 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20720 00000B2E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20721                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20722 00000B30 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20723                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20724 00000B37 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20725 00000B3E 40                      	inc	ax
 20726 00000B3F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20727                                  
 20728                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20729                                  
 20730 00000B41 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20731                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20732 00000B42 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20733 00000B48 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20734                                  
 20735                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20736                                  
 20737                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 20738 00000B4B B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 20739 00000B4E BE[C00A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 20740 00000B51 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 20741 00000B53 0E                      	push	cs
 20742 00000B54 1F                      	pop	ds
 20743 00000B55 FC                      	cld
 20744 00000B56 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 20745 00000B58 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 20746                                  
 20747                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 20748                                  
 20749                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20750 00000B59 57                      	push	di
 20751 00000B5A 06                      	push	es
 20752                                  
 20753                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20754                                  	;mov	es,ax
 20755                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20756 00000B5B 49                      	dec	cx
 20757                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 20758 00000B5C 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 20759                                  
 20760 00000B5E BF1000                  	mov	di,10h

 20763 00000B64 BE[F40A]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead

 20765                                  
 20766 00000B69 5F                      	pop	di
 20767 00000B6A 07                      	pop	es
 20768                                  
 20769 00000B6B C3                      	retn

 20773                                  ;

 20815                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 20816                                  
 20817                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20818                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 20819                                  
 20820                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20821                                  
 20822                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20823                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20824                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	     ;I070
 20825                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	     ;I070
 20826                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	     ;I070
 20827                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	     ;I070
 20828                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	     ;I070
 20829                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	     ;I070
 20830                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			     ;I070
 20831                                  ;								     ;I070
 20832                                  ;	in      al,64h         		; Test for passwd servr mode ;I070
 20833                                  ;	test    al,10h			; Is keyboard inhibited?     ;I070
 20834                                  ;	jnz     short ClrVDISKok	; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20835                                  ;					; Check for Tortugas...	     ;I070
 20836                                  ;	;;cmp	word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                	     ;I070
 20837                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],19F8h  ; ds = cs       
 20838                                  ;	mov	ax,[sys_model_byte]
 20839                                  ;	cmp	ax,19F8h
 20840                                  ;	je      short ClrVDISKno                            	     ;I070
 20841                                  ;					; Check for mod 30-286	     ;I070
 20842                                  ;	;;cmp	word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh			     ;I070
 20843                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],09FCh	
 20844                                  ;	cmp	ax,09FCh
 20845                                  ;	jne     short ClrVDISKok			      	     ;I070
 20846                                  ;ClrVDISKno:							     ;I070	
 20847                                  ;	retn	               		; Return w/o block move.     ;I070
 20848                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							     ;I070
 20849                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20850                                  
 20851                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20852                                  	; ds = cs
 20853                                  
 20854                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 20855                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 20856                                  
 20857 00000BBC 06                      	push	es
 20858 00000BBD 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 20859 00000BBF 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 20860 00000BC1 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 20861 00000BC3 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20862 00000BC5 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20863 00000BC7 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20864 00000BC9 05[9C0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead

 20894                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.

 20897                                  ;		the offset.
 20898                                  ;

 20976                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20977                                  ;
 20978                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20979                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20980                                  ;
 20981                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20982                                  
 20983                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20984                                  CPMHack:

 20990 00000C33 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20991 00000C34 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20992 00000C36 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20993 00000C39 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h

 20995 00000C3C B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20996 00000C3E FC                      	cld
 20997 00000C3F F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20998 00000C41 1F                      	pop	ds

 21919                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21920                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21921                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21922                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21923                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21924                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21925                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21926                                  ;
 21927                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21928                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21929                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21930                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21931                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21932                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21933                                  ;
 21934                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21935                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21936                                  ;
 21937                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21938                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21939                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21940                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21941                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21942                                  ;
 21943                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21944                                  ;
 21945                                  ;			  none.
 21946                                  
 21947                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21948                                  ;
 21949                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21950                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21951                                  
 21952                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21953

 22155                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22156                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22157                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 22158                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22159                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22160                                  ;
 22161                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22162                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22163                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22164                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22165                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 22166                                  ; program).
 22167                                  
 22168                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 22169                                  
 22170                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 22171                                  
 22172 000010B3 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 22173                                  
 22174                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 22175                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 22176                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 22177                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 22178                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 22179                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 22180                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 22181                                  ; carridge return.
 22182                                  
 22183                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 22184                                  ;character after =.
 22185                                  
 22186 000010B4 06                      	push	es
 22187 000010B5 1E                      	push	ds
 22188 000010B6 07                      	pop	es
 22189 000010B7 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 22190 000010B8 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 22191                                  
 22192 000010BA 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 22193 000010BC FC                      	cld
 22194 000010BD 2EC606[F102]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 22195 000010C3 BF[F202]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm

 22331                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22332                                  ;
 22333                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22334                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22335                                  ;
 22336                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22337                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22338                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22339                                  
 22340                                  ParaRound:
 22341 0000112F 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22342 00001132 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22343 00001134 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22344 00001136 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22345 00001138 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22346 0000113A C3                      	retn

 22348                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22349                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22350                                  ;
 22351                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22352                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22353                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22354                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22355                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22356                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22357                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22358                                  ;
 22359                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22360                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22361                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22362                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22363                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22364                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22365                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset value of end of sysinit module label
 22366                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22367                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22368                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22369                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22370                                  ;
 22371                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22372                                  
 22373                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22374                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22375                                  sysinit_base:				
 22376 0000113B 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22377 00001140 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22378 00001145 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22379 00001147 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22380 0000114C 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22381 00001151 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22382 00001152 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22383 00001153 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22384                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22385                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22386 00001155 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22387 00001158 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22388 0000115D 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22389                                  
 22390                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22391                                  
 22392 0000115F B409                    	mov	ah,9
 22393 00001161 0E                      	push	cs
 22394 00001162 1F                      	pop	ds
 22395                                  	; 30/12/2022
 22396                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 22397                                  	;mov	dx,102
 22398 00001163 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22399                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 22400 00001166 CD21                    	int	21h
 22401                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22402                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22403                                  
 22404                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 22405                                  stall:
 22406                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22407                                  _stall: 
 22408                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22409 00001168 F4                      	hlt 
 22410                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22411                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22412 00001169 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22413                                  
 22414                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22415 0000116B 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22416                                  
 22417                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22418                                  
 22419                                  sum_up:
 22420                                  
 22421                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22422                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22423                                  ;
 22424                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22425                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22426                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22427                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22428                                  ;
 22429                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22430                                  
 22431 00001170 1E                      	push	ds
 22432                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 22433                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 22434 00001171 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22435                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22436                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22437 00001175 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22438 00001177 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22439 00001179 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22440 0000117B 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22441                                  					; whole test better fail.
 22442 00001180 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22443 00001182 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22444                                  sum1:
 22445 00001184 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22446 00001186 46                      	inc	si
 22447 00001187 46                      	inc	si
 22448 00001188 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22449                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22450                                  sum_sys_code:
 22451                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22452 0000118A BE8A11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22453                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22454                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22455                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22456                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22457                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22458                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22459                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 22460 0000118D B9[504D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22461 00001190 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22462 00001192 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22463                                  sum2:
 22464 00001194 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22465 00001197 46                      	inc	si
 22466 00001198 46                      	inc	si
 22467 00001199 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22468 0000119B 1F                      	pop	ds
 22469 0000119C C3                      	retn
 22470                                  
 22471                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22472                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22473                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 22474                                  
 22475                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22476                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h)

 22494                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22495                                  ; Set_Buffer
 22496                                  ;
 22497                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 22498                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 22499                                  ;
 22500                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 22501                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 22502                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 22503                                  ;
 22504                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 22505                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 22506                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 22571                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22572                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22573                                  ;
 22574                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22575                                  ;
 22576                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22577                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 22578                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22579                                  
 22580                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22581                                  GetBufferAddr:
 22582 00001216 53                      	push	bx
 22583 00001217 52                      	push	dx
 22584 00001218 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 22585 0000121C 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 22586                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22587 00001221 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22588                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22589                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22590                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22591 00001224 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 22592 00001226 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22593 00001228 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 22594                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 22595 0000122B CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; DOS 5+ - ALLOCATE HMA SPACE
 22596                                  			;     AX = 4A02h
 22597                                  			;     BX = number of bytes
 22598                                  			; Return:
 22599                                  			;     ES:DI -> start of allocated HMA block or FFFFh:FFFFh
 22600                                  			;     BX = number of bytes actually allocated
 22601                                  			;	   (rounded up to next paragraph)
 22602                                  			; Notes:
 22603                                  			;     this call is not valid unless DOS is loaded in the HMA
 22604                                  			;     (DOS=HIGH)
 22605                                  
 22606 0000122D 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22607 00001230 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 22608                                  
 22609                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 22610                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22611                                  	; zf=1
 22612 00001232 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 22613                                  	; zf=1
 22614                                  	
 22615                                  	;zf=1
 22616                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 22617                                  	;zf=1
 22618 00001233 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 22619                                  got_hma:
 22620 00001238 5A                      	pop	dx
 22621 00001239 5B                      	pop	bx
 22622 0000123A C3                      	retn
 22623

 22639 00001240 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 22640 00001244 2EA3[BD02]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 22641 00001248 2E0306[9D02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; adjust ax
 22642                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 22643 0000124D 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 22644                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 22645 00001250 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 22646                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22647 00001256 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 22648                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22649 0000125C 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 22650 00001262 C3                      	retn
 22651                                  
 22652                                  ; ======================================================================
 22653                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22654                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22655                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22656                                  
 22657                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22658                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22659                                  ;
 22660                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22661                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22662                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22663                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22664                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22665                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22666                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22667                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22668                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22669                                  ;
 22670                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22671                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22672                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22673                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22674                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22675                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22676                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22677                                  ;	conditions:
 22678                                  ;
 22679                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22680                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22681                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22682                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22683                                  ;
 22684                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22685                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22686                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22687                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22688                                  ;
 22689                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22690                                  ;
 22691                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22692                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22693                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22694                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22695                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22696                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22697                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22698                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22699                                  ;
 22700                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22701                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22702                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22703                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22704                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement stack logic in this case.
 22705                                  ;
 22706                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22707                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22708                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22709                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22710                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22711                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22712                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22713                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22714                                  ;
 22715                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22716                                  
 22717                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22718                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22719                                  
 22720                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22721                                  stackinit:
 22722 00001263 50                      	push	ax
 22723 00001264 1E                      	push	ds
 22724 00001265 06                      	push	es
 22725 00001266 53                      	push	bx
 22726 00001267 51                      	push	cx
 22727 00001268 52                      	push	dx
 22728 00001269 57                      	push	di
 22729 0000126A 56                      	push	si
 22730 0000126B 55                      	push	bp
 22731                                  
 22732                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22733                                  
 22734                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22735                                  	; ds = cs
 22736 0000126C A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22737 0000126F 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22738                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22739                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22740                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22741 00001271 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22742                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22743 00001275 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22744 00001278 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22745                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22746 0000127C A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22747                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22748                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22749                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22750 0000127F 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22751                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22752 00001283 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22753 00001285 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22754                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22755                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22756                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22757 00001288 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22758                                  
 22759                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22760                                  
 22761                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22762                                  
 22763                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22764                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22765                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22766 0000128C 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22767

 22769                                  
 22770 00001291 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8

 22775 00001296 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22776 00001298 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22777 0000129C 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22778 0000129E 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22779                                  
 22780                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22781                                  
 22782 000012A1 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]

 22785 000012AC 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22786 000012AE 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22787 000012B0 06                      	push	es
 22788 000012B1 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22789                                  
 22790                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22791                                  
 22792 000012B2 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22793 000012B6 FC                      	cld
 22794 000012B7 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22795                                  
 22796 000012B9 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]

 22799                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22800                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 22801                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 22802                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry

 23559                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23560                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23561                                  
 23562                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23563                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23564                                  
 23565                                  ; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23566                                  ; (SYSINIT:1745h)
 23567                                  
 23568                                  new_init_loop:
 23569                                  
 23570                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23571                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23572                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23573                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23574                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23575                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23576                                  
 23577                                  ; 13/04/2024
 23578                                  %if 0
 23579                                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23580                                  	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23581                                  	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23582                                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23583                                  
 23584                                  	push	ds
 23585                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23586                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23587                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23588                                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23589                                  	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23590                                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23591                                  	mov	[di],ax
 23592                                  	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23593                                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23594                                  	pop	ds
 23595                                  %else
 23596                                  	; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v4.2
 23597 00001455 1E                      	push	ds
 23598 00001456 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23599 0000145A 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23600 0000145D 50                      	push	ax
 23601 0000145E 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23602 00001461 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23603 00001463 50                      	push	ax
 23604 00001464 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23605 00001467 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23606 00001469 58                      	pop	ax			;int 19 handler
 23607 0000146A 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23608 0000146C 58                      	pop	ax
 23609 0000146D 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23610 00001470 1F                      	pop	ds
 23611                                  %endif
 23612 00001471 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23613 00001474 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23614 00001478 C3                      	retn
 23615                                  
 23616                                  
 23617                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine

 23620                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23621                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 23622                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 23623                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 23624                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 23625                                  ;out: devmark established.
 23626                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 23627                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 23628                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23629                                  
 23630                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23631                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 23632                                  ; 04/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23633                                  ; (SYSINIT:176Ch)
 23634                                  
 23635                                  ; 04/09/2023 - PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM (SYSINIT:1944h)
 23636                                  
 23637                                  setdevmark:
 23638                                  
 23639                                  	; 04/09/2023
 23640                                  	;push	es
 23641                                  	;push	cx
 23642                                  
 23643 00001479 2E8B0E[6403]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 23644 0000147E 2E890E[9C14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 23645 00001483 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 23646                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23647                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 23648 00001485 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 23649 00001489 41                      	inc	cx
 23650                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 23651 0000148A 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 23652                                  
 23653                                  	; 04/09/2023
 23654                                  	;pop	cx
 23655                                  	;pop	es
 23656                                  	
 23657 0000148F 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 23658 00001494 C3                      	retn

 23701                                  ;ifdef MULTI_CONFIG
 23702                                  ;
 23703                                  ;   config_envlen must immediately precede config_wrkseg, because they
 23704                                  ;   may be loaded as a dword ptr
 23705                                  
 23706                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 23707                                  ; 25/10/2022
 23708 00001495 0000                    config_envlen:	dw  0  			; when config_wrkseg is being used as
 23709                                                 				;  a scratch env, this is its length
 23710 00001497 0000                    config_wrkseg:	dw  0			; config work area (above confbot)
 23711                                                     			;  segment of work area
 23712

 23860                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23861                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 23862                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 23863                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 23864                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23865                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 23866                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 23867                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 23868                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23869                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 23870                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23871                                  
 23872                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 23873                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 23874 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX

 23876 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 23877                                  endstruc

 23885                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE

 23889                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 23890                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
