 27710                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27711                                  ; buffer command
 27712                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27713                                  
 27714                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27715                                  ;									      *
 27716                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27717                                  ;									      *
 27718                                  ; input :								      *
 27719                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27720                                  ; output:								      *
 27721                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27722                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 27723                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 27724                                  ;									      *
 27725                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27726                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27727                                  ; logic:								      *
 27728                                  ; {									      *
 27729                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 27730                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27731                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 27732                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27733                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27734                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27735                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 27736                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 27737                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 27738                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 27739                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 27740                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 27741                                  ;	};								      *
 27742                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 27743                                  ; };									      *
 27744                                  ;									      *
 27745                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27746                                  
 27747                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27748                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 27749                                  tryb:
 27750 0000212F 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 27751 00002132 755C                    	jne	short tryc
 27752                                  
 27753                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27754                                  ; (SYSINIT:24BFh)
 27755                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27756                                  ;%if 0
 27757                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27758 00002134 E83D1F                  	call	query_user		; query the user if config_cmd
 27759 00002137 7257                    	jc	short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27760                                  ;endif
 27761                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27762                                  
 27763                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27764                                  	; 18/12/2022
 27765 00002139 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27766                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 27767 0000213B 880E[4A1D]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 27768                                  
 27769 0000213F BF[031D]                	mov	di,buf_parms
 27770                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 27771                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27772                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27773                                  do7:
 27774 00002142 E87C07                  	call	sysinit_parse
 27775 00002145 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 27776                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 27777                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 27778                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27779                                  ;sr7:
 27780                                  	;jmp	coff
 27781                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27782 00002147 E9A606                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27783                                  if7:
 27784 0000214A 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 27785 0000214D 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 27786                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x ; (/X switch)
 27787 0000214F 813E[4E1D][431D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x

 27794                                  if11:

 27807 00002167 EBD9                    	jmp	short do7
 27808                                  en7:
 27809 00002169 833E[461D]63            	cmp	word [p_buffers],99
 27810 0000216E 760B                    	jbe	short if18
 27811                                  
 27812                                  ;	cmp	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; M016
 27813                                  ;	jne	short if18
 27814                                  
 27815 00002170 E87907                  	call	badparm_p

 27817 00002179 EB12                    	jmp	short sr7
 27818                                  if18:
 27819 0000217B A1[461D]                	mov	ax,[p_buffers]	; we don't have any problem.

 28512                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
 28513                                  ;	interlnk) look at the internal DOS variable instead of the

 29450                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29451                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 29452                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 29453                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 29454                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 29455                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 29456                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 29457                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 29458                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29459                                  
 29460                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29461                                  ;									  *
 29462                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 29463                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 29464                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 29465                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 29466                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 29467                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 29468                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 29469                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 29470                                  ; input :								  *
 29471                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 29472                                  ; output:								  *
 29473                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 29474                                  ;									  *
 29475                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 29476                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 29477                                  ; logic:								  *
 29478                                  ; {									  *
 29479                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 29480                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 29481                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 29482                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 29483                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 29484                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 29485                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29486                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 29487                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29488                                  ;	     }								  *
 29489                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 29490                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 29491                                  ;	};								  *
 29492                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 29493                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 29494                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 29495                                  ; };									  *
 29496                                  ;**************************************************************************

 30243                                  sysinit_parse:
 30244                                  
 30245                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30246                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 30247                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 30248                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 30249                                  ;
 30250                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 30251                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 30252                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 30253                                  ;	*** after each call.
 30254                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 30255                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 30256                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 30257                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 30258                                  ;	 procedure.
 30259                                  ;	ax - exit code
 30260                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 30261                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 30262                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 30263                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 30264                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30610                                  ;
 30611                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 30612                                  ;
 30613                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 30614                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 30615                                  ;
 30616                                  ;	Output : none
 30617                                  ;
 30618                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 30619                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 30620                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30621                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 30622                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30623                                  ;
 30624                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30625                                  
 30626                                  LieInt12Mem:
 30627                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30628                                  	; ds = cs
 30629 00002966 A1[A502]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 30630                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12h as alloclim
 30631                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 30632 00002969 E84200                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 30633 0000296C 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 30634                                  	; 13/05/2019
 30635                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 30636                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 30637                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12h as end of UMB
 30638                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30639                                  	; ds = cs
 30640 0000296E 803E[581F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 30641 00002973 74F0                    	je	short limx
 30642 00002975 A1[3E1F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 30643                                  lim_set:
 30644                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 30645                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30646                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 30647                                  ;limx:
 30648                                  	;retn
 30649                                  	
 30650                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 30651                                  
 30652                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30653                                  ;
 30654                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 30655                                  ;
 30656                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 30657                                  ;	Output : none
 30658                                  ;
 30659                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 30660                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30661                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30662                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 30663                                  ;
 30664                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30665                                  
 30666                                  	; 01/11/2022
 30667                                  SetInt12Mem:
 30668 00002978 1E                      	push	ds
 30669 00002979 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 30670 0000297C 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 30671 0000297E 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 30672                                  	;mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 30673 00002982 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 30674 00002984 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 30675 00002986 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 30676                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 30677 00002989 1F                      	pop	ds
 30678                                  	; 14/04/2024
 30679                                  	; ds = cs
 30680 0000298A 891E[5C1F]              	mov	[OldInt12Mem],bx
 30681 0000298E C606[5B1F]FF            	mov	byte [Int12Lied],0FFh
 30682                                  ;limx:
 30683 00002993 C3                      	retn
 30684                                  
 30685                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30686                                  ;
 30687                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 30688                                  ;
 30689                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 30690                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 30691                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 30692                                  ;
 30693                                  ;	Output : none
 30694                                  ;
 30695                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 30696                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 30697                                  ;
 30698                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30699                                  
 30700                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 30701                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30702                                  	; ds = cs
 30703 00002994 803E[5B1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30704                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 30705                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 30706                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 30707 00002999 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 30708                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30709 0000299B B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 30710 0000299E 8826[5B1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 30711                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30712                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 30713 000029A2 1E                      	push	ds
 30714                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 30715 000029A3 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 30716 000029A5 2EA1[5C1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 30717 000029A9 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12h memory
 30718 000029AC 1F                      	pop	ds
 30719                                  timx:
 30720 000029AD C3                      	retn

 30775                                  
 30776                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30777                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30778                                  
 30779                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30780                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30781                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30782                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30783                                  
 30784                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30785                                  ;
 30786                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30787                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30788                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30789                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30790                                  ;
 30791                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30792                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30793                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30794                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30795                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30796                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30797                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30798                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30799                                  ; available during the load.
 30800                                  ;
 30801                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30802                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30803                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30804                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30805                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30806                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30807                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30808                                  ;
 30809                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30810                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30811                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30812                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30813                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30814                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30815                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30816                                  ;
 30817                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30818                                  
 30819                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30820                                  
 30821                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30822                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30823                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30824                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30825                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30826                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30827                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30828                                  
 30829                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30830                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30831                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30832                                  
 30833                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30834                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30835                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30836                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30837                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30838                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30839                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30840                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30841                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 30842                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30843                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30844                                  
 30845                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30846                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30847                                  
 30848                                  InitVar:
 30849                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30850                                  	; ds = cs
 30851                                  
 30852                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 30853                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30854                                  	;push	ax
 30855                                  	;push	cx
 30856                                  	;push	di
 30857 000029D8 06                      	push	es
 30858                                  
 30859                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 30860 000029D9 0E                      	push	cs
 30861 000029DA 07                      	pop	es
 30862                                  
 30863 000029DB 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30864                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30865                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30866                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30867                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30868                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30869                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 30870                                  
 30871                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30872                                  	; ds = cs
 30873 000029DD A2[031F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30874 000029E0 A2[021F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30875 000029E3 A3[041F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30876 000029E6 C606[061F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30877                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30878 000029EB A2[391F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 30879                                  
 30880 000029EE FC                      	cld
 30881                                  
 30882 000029EF B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 30883 000029F2 BF[071F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 30884 000029F5 F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 30885                                  
 30886                                  	;mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 30887                                  	; 01/01/2033
 30888 000029F7 B110                    	mov	cl,MAXUMB ; 16
 30889 000029F9 BF[171F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 30890 000029FC F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 30891                                  
 30892                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 30893                                  
 30894                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 30895 000029FE 07                      	pop	es
 30896                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30897                                  	;pop	di
 30898                                  	;pop	cx
 30899                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 30900                                  
 30901 000029FF C3                      	retn
 30902                                  
 30903                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30904                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30905                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30906                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30907                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30908                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30909                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30910                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30911                                  
 30912                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30913                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 30914                                  FixMem:
 30915                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30916                                  	;push	ax
 30917                                  	;push	bx
 30918                                  	;push	cx
 30919                                  	;push	dx
 30920 00002A00 06                      	push	es
 30921                                  
 30922 00002A01 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30923                                  
 30924 00002A04 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30925 00002A07 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30926                                  
 30927 00002A09 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30928                                  
 30929                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30930                                  
 30931 00002A0B 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30932 00002A0D 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30933 00002A0F 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30934                                  
 30935                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30936                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30937                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30938                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30939                                  
 30940 00002A10 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30941 00002A14 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30942 00002A19 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30943 00002A1B 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30944                                  
 30945                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30946                                  
 30947 00002A1D 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30948 00002A22 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30949 00002A24 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30950                                  
 30951 00002A28 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30952                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30953                                  	; 11/07/2023
 30954 00002A2D 43                      	inc	bx
 30955 00002A2E 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30956                                  
 30957                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30958                                  
 30959 00002A33 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Save MCB address
 30960 00002A35 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30961                                  
 30962 00002A3A 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30963                                  	;add	bx,[es:3]
 30964 00002A3C 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30965 00002A41 43                      	inc	bx
 30966 00002A42 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 30967                                  
 30968                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30969 00002A44 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30970 00002A46 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30971                                  fmX:	
 30972 00002A48 E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30973                                  
 30974 00002A4B 07                      	pop	es
 30975                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30976                                  	;pop	dx
 30977                                  	;pop	cx
 30978                                  	;pop	bx
 30979                                  	;pop	ax
 30980                                  
 30981 00002A4C C3                      	retn
 30982                                  
 30983                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30984                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30985                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30986                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30987                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30988                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30989                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30990                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30991                                  
 30992                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30993                                  fm_link:
 30994 00002A4D B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 30995 00002A50 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 30996                                  
 30997                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 30998                                  	;
 30999                                  	;push	es
 31000                                  	;push	cs
 31001                                  	;pop	es
 31002                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 31003                                  	;pop	es
 31004                                  	
 31005                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31006                                  	; ds = cs
 31007                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 31008 00002A52 A2[371F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 31009                                  
 31010 00002A55 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 31011 00002A58 BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 31012 00002A5B CD21                    	int	21h
 31013 00002A5D C3                      	retn
 31014                                  
 31015                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31016                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 31017                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31018                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 31019                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31020                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31021                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 31022                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31023                                  
 31024                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31025                                  fm_unlink:
 31026 00002A5E 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 31027                                  	
 31028                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 31029                                  	;
 31030                                  	;push	ds
 31031                                  	;push	cs
 31032                                  	;pop	ds
 31033                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 31034                                  	;pop	ds
 31035                                  	
 31036                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31037                                  	; ds = cs
 31038                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 31039 00002A60 8A1E[371F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 31040                                  
 31041 00002A64 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 31042 00002A67 CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 31043 00002A69 C3                      	retn
 31044                                  
 31045                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31046                                  
 31047                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31048                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 31049                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 31050                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31051                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 31052                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 31053                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 31054                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31055                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31056                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 31057                                  ;
 31058                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 31059                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 31060                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31061                                  ;
 31062                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 31063                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 31064                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 31065                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 31066                                  ;
 31067                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 31068                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 31069                                  ;
 31070                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31071                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 31072                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 31073                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 31074                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 31075                                  ;     lh
 31076                                  ;     /l
 31077                                  ;     1
 31078                                  ;     1000
 31079                                  ;     2
 31080                                  ;     print
 31081                                  ;     /d
 31082                                  ;     :lpt2
 31083                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 31084                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 31085                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 31086                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 31087                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 31088                                  ; for:
 31089                                  ;    Each /L
 31090                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 31091                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 31092                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 31093                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 31094                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 31095                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31096                                  
 31097                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31098                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 31099                                  
 31100                                  ParseVar:
 31101                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 31102                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31103                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31104 00002A6A 1E                      	push	ds
 31105 00002A6B 06                      	push	es
 31106                                  
 31107 00002A6C 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 31108 00002A6D 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 31109 00002A6E FC                      	cld
 31110                                  
 31111                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31112                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 31113                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31114                                  
 31115 00002A6F AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 31116 00002A70 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 31117 00002A73 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 31118                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31119 00002A75 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 31120 00002A77 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 31121                                  
 31122 00002A79 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 31123 00002A7A F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 31124 00002A7B EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 31125                                  pv20:	
 31126 00002A7D AC                      	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 31127                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 31128 00002A7E 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 31129                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 31130 00002A80 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 31131 00002A82 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 31132                                  
 31133                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31134 00002A84 2EFE06[391F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31135                                  
 31136                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 31137                                  	;
 31138                                  	;push	es
 31139                                  	;push	cs
 31140                                  	;pop	es
 31141                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 31142                                  	;pop	es
 31143                                  
 31144 00002A89 2EC606[031F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 31145                                  
 31146 00002A8F EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 31147                                  
 31148                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 31149 00002A91 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then it's a bad
 31150 00002A93 750D                    	jne	short pvE1	; switch!
 31151                                  
 31152                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31153 00002A95 2EFE06[391F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31154                                  
 31155 00002A9A E80E00                  	call	parseL
 31156 00002A9D 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 31157                                  
 31158 00002A9F 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 31159 00002AA0 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 31160                                  
 31161                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 31162 00002AA2 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31163 00002AA5 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 31164 00002AA6 4E                      	dec	si
 31165 00002AA7 F9                      	stc
 31166                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 31167 00002AA8 07                      	pop	es
 31168 00002AA9 1F                      	pop	ds
 31169                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31170                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31171 00002AAA C3                      	retn
 31172                                  
 31173                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31174                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 31175                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31176                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 31177                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 31178                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 31179                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 31180                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31181                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 31182                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 31183                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax. The 3-character rewind
 31184                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 31185                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31186                                  
 31187                                  parseL:
 31188 00002AAB AC                      	lodsb
 31189 00002AAC 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 31190 00002AAE 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 31191                                  
 31192                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31193                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 31194                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31195                                  
 31196 00002AB0 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, it's ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 31197 00002AB3 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 31198 00002AB5 E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 31199                                  
 31200 00002AB8 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 31201 00002ABA E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 31202 00002ABD 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 31203                                  
 31204                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 31205 00002ABF 2EFE06[391F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31206                                  
 31207 00002AC4 AC                      	lodsb
 31208 00002AC5 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 31209 00002AC7 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 31210                                  
 31211 00002AC9 E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 31212 00002ACC 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 31213                                  
 31214 00002ACE E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 31215 00002AD1 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31216                                  
 31217                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31218 00002AD3 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 31219 00002AD5 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 31220                                  
 31221 00002AD7 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 31222 00002AD9 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 31223                                  
 31224                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 31225                                  
 31226 00002ADB E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else

 31295                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31296                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31297                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31298                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31299                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31300                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31301                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31302                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 31304                                  isEOL:

 31306 00002B0C 7406                    	je	short ieX
 31307 00002B0E 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 31308 00002B10 7402                    	je	short ieX
 31309 00002B12 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed

 31315                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31316                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31317                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if AL contains space, tab, or equals
 31318                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31319                                  ; USES:     ZF

 31326 00002B1B 7402                    	je	short iwX

 31328                                  iwX:

 31382                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31383                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 31384                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 31385                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 31386                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 31387                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31388                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 31389                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31390                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 31391                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31392                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31393                                  
 31394                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31395                                  stowUMB:
 31396 00002B33 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 31397 00002B35 7202                    	jb	short su10
 31398 00002B37 F9                      	stc
 31399 00002B38 C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB # >= MAXUMB
 31400                                  su10:	
 31401                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31402                                  	;push	bx
 31403                                  	;push	di
 31404                                  	;push	si
 31405                                  	;push	ds
 31406                                  	;push	es
 31407                                  	;push	cs
 31408                                  	;pop	es
 31409                                  	;push	cs
 31410                                  	;pop	ds
 31411                                  
 31412                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31413                                  	; ds <> cs
 31414                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 31415 00002B39 2E803E[061F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 31416                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 31417 00002B3F 7504                    	jne	short su20
 31418 00002B41 2EA2[061F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31419                                  
 31420                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 31421                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 31422                                  	;jne	short su20
 31423                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31424                                  su20:	
 31425 00002B45 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 31426 00002B47 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.

 31429                                  	;xor	bh,bh

 31441                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.

 31444

 31452                                  	;pop	si
 31453                                  	;pop	di
 31454                                  	;pop	bx
 31455 00002B57 C3                      	retn

 31495                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31496                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 31497                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 31498                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 31499                                  ; A-F are considered valid if gnradix is 16.
 31500                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31501                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 31502                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 31503                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 31504                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 31505                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31506                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31507                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31508                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31509                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31510                                  
 31511                                  gnradix:
 31512 00002B58 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 31513                                  
 31514                                  toDigit:
 31515 00002B5A 2E833E[582B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 31516 00002B60 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 31517                                  
 31518                                  toDigit_hex:
 31519 00002B62 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 31520 00002B65 7209                    	jb	short td10
 31521 00002B67 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 31522 00002B6A 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'f' at all...
 31523 00002B6C 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 31524                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31525 00002B6F C3                      	retn
 31526                                  td10:	
 31527 00002B70 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 31528 00002B73 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'? Not a letter...
 31529 00002B75 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 31530 00002B78 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'? Not a digit.
 31531 00002B7A 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 31532                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31533 00002B7D C3                      	retn
 31534                                  toDigit_dec:
 31535                                  td20:	
 31536 00002B7E 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 31537                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 31538 00002B81 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 31539 00002B83 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 31540 00002B86 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 31541 00002B88 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 31542                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31543 00002B8B C3                      	retn
 31544                                  tdE:	
 31545 00002B8C F9                      	stc
 31546                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 31547 00002B8D C3                      	retn
 31548                                  
 31549                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31550                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 31551                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31552                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 31553                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 31554                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 31555                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 31556                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31557                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31558                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31559                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31560                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31561                                  
 31562                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31563                                  
 31564                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31565                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 31566                                  
 31567                                  GetXNum:
 31568                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 31569                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31570                                  	;push	bx
 31571 00002B8E 51                      	push	cx ; *
 31572                                  	;push	ds
 31573                                  
 31574 00002B8F FC                      	cld
 31575 00002B90 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 31576 00002B92 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 31577 00002B94 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 31578 00002B96 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 31579                                  
 31580 00002B98 2EC706[582B]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 31581                                  
 31582 00002B9F 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 31583                                  	;call	toDigit
 31584 00002BA2 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 31585                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 31586                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31587 00002BA5 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 31588                                  
 31589 00002BA7 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 31590 00002BA9 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 31591 00002BAB 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 31592 00002BAF 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 31593 00002BB2 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 31594 00002BB4 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 31595 00002BB7 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 31596                                  
 31597                                  gxn10:	
 31598 00002BB9 2EC706[582B]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 31599 00002BC0 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 31600 00002BC1 46                      	inc	si
 31601                                  
 31602                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31603                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 31604                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 31605                                  ;        BX    = 0
 31606                                  ;        CH    = 0
 31607                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31608                                  
 31609                                  gxn20:	
 31610 00002BC2 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 31611 00002BC5 46                      	inc	si
 31612                                  
 31613 00002BC6 E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 31614 00002BC9 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 31615                                  
 31616 00002BCB E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 31617 00002BCE 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 31618                                  
 31619 00002BD0 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 31620 00002BD2 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 if last add wrapped
 31621                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 31622                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 31623 00002BD4 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 31624                                  gxnE:	
 31625                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 31626 00002BD6 EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 31627                                  gxnQ:	
 31628 00002BD8 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 31629 00002BD9 F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 31630                                  gxnX:	
 31631                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31632                                  	;pop	ds
 31633 00002BDA 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 31634                                  	;pop	bx
 31635 00002BDB C3                      	retn
 31636                                  
 31637                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31638                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 31639                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31640                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 31641                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 31642                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 31643                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31644                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31645                                  
 31646                                  mul32:
 31647 00002BDC 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31648 00002BDD 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31649 00002BDF 2EF726[582B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31650 00002BE4 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 31651                                  
 31652 00002BE6 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31653 00002BE8 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31654                                  
 31655 00002BE9 87DA                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31656 00002BEB 2EF726[582B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31657 00002BF0 87DA                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31658 00002BF2 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31659 00002BF4 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31660 00002BF6 C3                      	retn
 31661                                  m32E:	
 31662 00002BF7 58                      	pop	ax
 31663 00002BF8 C3                      	retn
 31664                                  
 31665                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31666                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 31667                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31668                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 31669                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 31670                                  ; ERROR:   None
 31671                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31672                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31673                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 31674                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 31675                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31676                                  
 31677                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31678                                  toPara:
 31679 00002BF9 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 31680                                  
 31681 00002BFA B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 31682 00002BFC D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 31683 00002BFE 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 31684 00002BFF B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 31685 00002C01 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 31686 00002C03 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 31687                                  
 31688 00002C05 59                      	pop	cx
 31689 00002C06 C3                      	retn
 31690                                  
 31691                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31692                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 31693                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31694                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 31695                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 31696                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 31697                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31698                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31699                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 31700                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 31701                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 31702                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 31703                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31704                                  
 31705                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31706                                  UmbHead:
 31707                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 31708                                  
 31709                                  	;push	si ; ?
 31710                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 31711                                  	;push	es
 31712                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 31713                                  
 31714                                  	; 09/04/2019
 31715                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 31716                                  
 31717 00002C07 B452                    	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 31718 00002C09 CD21                    	int	21h
 31719                                  
 31720 00002C0B 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 31721                                  	
 31722                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31723 00002C0F 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31724 00002C12 F5                      	cmc
 31725                                  	; if AX=0FFFFh -> CF=1
 31726 00002C13 C3                      	retn
 31727                                  
 31728                                  ; 01/01/2023
 31729                                  ;%if 0
 31730                                  ;	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31731                                  ;	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 31732                                  ;
 31733                                  ;	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 31734                                  ;	;jmp	short uhX
 31735                                  ;	; 12/12/2022
 31736                                  ;	retn
 31737                                  ;uhE:	
 31738                                  ;	stc
 31739                                  ;uhX:

 31747                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31748                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF if ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 31749                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31750                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 31751                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 31752                                  ; USES:   Flags
 31753                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31754                                  
 31755                                  isSysMCB:
 31756                                  	;push	ax
 31757                                  
 31758                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; Check the owner...
 31759                                  	;cmp	ax,SystemPSPOwner	; 8 (for US OR Japan) is valid
 31760                                  	;je	short ism10
 31761                                  	;cmp	ax,JapanPSPOwner	; 9 (for Japan) is valid
 31762                                  	;;je	short ism10
 31763                                  	;;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 31764                                  	;jne	short ismX
 31765 00002C14 26833E010008            	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 31766 00002C1A 7507                    	jne	short ismX 
 31767                                  ism10:	
 31768                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.NAME]	; Check the name...
 31769                                  	;cmp	ax,'SC' ; 4353h
 31770 00002C1C 26813E08005343          	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'
 31771                                  ismX:	
 31772                                  	;pop	ax
 31773 00002C23 C3                      	retn
